abstract_policy.description: A base abstract class for all configuration policies that can be applied to policies, profiles, and templates.
abstract_policy.title: abstract_policy - policy.AbstractPolicy

assignment_order.description:
Assignment order decides the order in which the next identifier is allocated.  Options are:
  * default
  * sequential: (default)
assignment_order.title: assignment_order

name.description: Name of the profile instance or profile template.
name.title: name

user_label.description: User label assigned to the profile.
user_label.title: user_label

serial_number.description: Serial Number of the Device.  You can assign unknown if you want to generate the Profile without assigning hardware.  If you don't yet know the serial number you can enter `unknown`.
serial_number.title: serial_number

adapter_configuration.description: An Adapter Configuration Policy configures the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel settings for the VIC adapter.
adapter_configuration.title: adapter_configuration - Adapter Configuration - Intersight Uri: adapter/ConfigPolicies

allOf.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'adapter.ConfigPolicy', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
allOf.title: adapter_configuration

add_vic_adapter_configuration.description:
List of 'adapter.ConfigPolicy' resources

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
add_vic_adapter_configuration.title: add_vic_adapter_configuration - Add Vic Adapter Configuration

enable_fip.description: Default is `true`.  Status of FIP protocol on the adapter interfaces.
enable_fip.title: enable_fip

enable_lldp.description: Default is `true`.  Status of LLDP protocol on the adapter interfaces.
enable_lldp.title: enable_lldp

enable_physical_nic_mode.description: Default is `false`.  When Physical NIC Mode is enabled, up-link ports of the VIC are set to pass-through mode. This allows the host to transmit packets without any modification. When Physical NIC Mode is enabled, VLAN tagging of the packets will not happen.
enable_physical_nic_mode.title: enable_physical_nic_mode

enable_port_channel.description: Default is `true`.  When Port Channel is enabled, two vNICs and two vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card. When disabled, four vNICs and four vHBAs are available for use on the adapter card. Disabling port channel reboots the server. Port Channel is supported only for Cisco VIC 1455/1457 adapters.
enable_port_channel.title: enable_port_channel

pci_slot.description: PCIe slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
pci_slot.title: pci_slot

adapter_configuration.add_vic_adapter_co.description:
Settings applicable for the Data Center Ethernet (DCE) interfaces on the adapter card.

Required Attributes:
  * dce_interface_1_fec_mode
  * dce_interface_2_fec_mode
  * dce_interface_3_fec_mode
  * dce_interface_4_fec_mode
adapter_configuration.add_vic_adapter_co.title: dce_interface_settings

dce_interface_1_fec_mode.description:
Default is 'cl91'.  Forward Error Correction (FEC) mode setting for the DCE interface of the adapter. FEC mode setting is supported only for Cisco VIC 14xx adapters. FEC mode 'cl74' is unsupported for Cisco VIC 1495/1497. This setting will be ignored for unsupported adapters and for unavailable DCE interfaces.
  * `cl74` - Use cl74 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 74' aka FC-FEC ('FireCode' FEC) offers simple, low-latency protection against 1 burst/sparse bit error, but it is not good for random errors.
  * `cl91` - Use cl91 standard as FEC mode setting. 'Clause 91' aka RS-FEC ('ReedSolomon' FEC) offers better error protection against bursty and random errors but adds latency.
  * `Off` - Disable FEC mode on the DCE Interface.
dce_interface_1_fec_mode.title: dce_interface_1_fec_mode - Dce Interface 1 Fec Mode - object_type: adapter.DceInterfaceSettings

  * `Off` - Disable FEC mode on the DCE Interface.
dce_interface_2_fec_mode.title: dce_interface_2_fec_mode - Dce Interface 2 Fec Mode - object_type: adapter.DceInterfaceSettings

bios.description: Policy for setting BIOS tokens on the endpoint.
bios.title: bios - Bios - Intersight Uri: bios/Policies

allOf.description:
A BIOS policy automates the configuration of BIOS settings on servers. You can create one or more BIOS policies that contain a specific grouping of BIOS settings, matching the needs of a server or a set of servers. If you do not specify a BIOS policy for a server, the BIOS settings will default to set of values for a brand new baremetal server or to a set of values previously configured using Cisco IMC. If a BIOS policy is specified, its values replace any previously configured values on the server.
All BIOS tokens are not applicable to all servers. If unsupported tokens are pushed to a server, those tokens are ignored.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: bios_template

  * description
  * tags

allOf.title: bios

acpi_srat_sp_flag_en.description:
Default is `platform-default`.  BIOS Token for setting ACPI SRAT Special Purpose Memory Flag configuration.
  * `platform-default` - Default value used by the platform for the BIOS setting.
  * `enabled` - Enables the BIOS setting.
  * `disabled` - Disables the BIOS setting.
acpi_srat_sp_flag_en.title: acpi_srat_sp_flag_en

acs_control_gpu1state.description:
Default is `platform-default`.  BIOS Token for setting ACS Control GPU 1 configuration.
  * platform-default - Default value used by the platform for the BIOS setting.
  * enabled - Enables the BIOS setting.
  * disabled - Disables the BIOS setting.
acs_control_gpu1state.title: acs_control_gpu1state

acs_control_gpu2state.description:
Default is `platform-default`.  BIOS Token for setting ACS Control GPU 2 configuration.

bios_template.description:
Name of a BIOS Template to Configure.

Important Note: Add `-tpm/Tpm` to enable TPM.  Without `-tpm/Tpm`, TPM is disabled.

Options are:

  * AnalyticalDatabaseSystems-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Analytical Database Systems on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * AnalyticalDatabaseSystems-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Analytical Database Systems on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * AnalyticsDatabaseSystems-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Analytics Database Decision-Support System on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * CPUIntensive-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for CPU Intensive on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * CPUIntensive-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for CPU Intensive on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * ComputationIntensive-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for CPU Intensive on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * DataAnalytics-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Data Analytics on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * DataAnalytics-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Data Analytics on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * EnergyEfficiency-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Energy Efficiency on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * EnergyEfficiency-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Energy Efficiency on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * EnergyEfficiency-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Energy Efficiency on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * EnergyEfficient-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Energy Efficiency on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * HighPerformanceComputing-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for High-Performance Computing on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * HighPerformanceComputing-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for High-Performance Computing on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * HighPerformanceComputing-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for High-Performance Computing on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * HighPerformanceComputing-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for High-Performance Computing on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * IOIntensive-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for IO Intensive on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * IOIntensive-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for IO Intensive on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * JavaApplicationServer-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Java Application Server on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * LowLatency-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Low Latency on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * LowLatency-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Low Latency on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * LowLatency-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Low Latency on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * LowLatency-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Low Latency on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * M5-amd-virtual(-tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with AMD processors
  * M5-intel-virtual(-tpm) - (Depricated - Use Virtualization-M5-Intel(-Tpm)) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * M6-amd-virtual(-tpm) - (Depricated - Use Virtualization-M6-AMD(-Tpm)) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * M6-intel-virtual(-tpm) - (Depricated - Use Virtualization-M6-Intel(-Tpm)) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * MaximumPerformance-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Maximum Performance on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * OnlineTransactionProcessing-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Online Transaction Processing on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * RelationalDatabaseSystems-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Relational Database Systems on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * RelationalDatabaseSystems-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Relational Database Systems on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * VDI-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for VDI on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * Virtualization-M5-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M5 Servers with Intel processors
  * Virtualization-M6-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with AMD processors
  * Virtualization-M6-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M6 Servers with Intel processors
  * Virtualization-M7-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M7 Servers with Intel processors
  * Virtualization-M8-AMD(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M8 Servers with AMD processors
  * Virtualization-M8-Intel(-Tpm) - BIOS Policy for Virtualization on Cisco UCS M8 Servers with AMD processors
bios_template.title: bios_template

boot_order.description: Boot order policy models a reusable boot order configuration that can be applied to multiple servers via profile association. It supports advanced boot order configuration on Cisco CIMC servers.
boot_order.title: boot_order - Boot Order - Intersight Uri: boot/PrecisionPolicies

allOf.description: Boot order policy models a reusable boot order configuration that can be applied to multiple servers via profile association. It supports advanced boot order configuration on Cisco CIMC servers.
allOf.title: boot_order

boot_devices.description:
List of Boot Devices and their Attributes to Assign to the Boot Policy.

`flex_mmc` - UCS Standalone Only - Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`flex_mmc` - Optional Attributes:
  * subtype - Default is `flexmmc-mapped-dvd`.

`http_boot` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * interface_source

`http_boot` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * interface_name - Required if `interface_source` is `name`.
  * ip_config_type - Default is `DHCP`.
  * ip_type - Default is `IPv4`.
  * ipv4_config - Required if `ip_config_type` is `Static` and `ip_type` is `IPv4`.
  * ipv6_config - Required if `ip_config_type` is `Static` and `ip_type` is `IPv6`.
  * mac_address - Required if `interface_source` is `mac`.
  * port - Required if `interface_source` is `port`.
  * protocol - Default is `HTTPS`.
  * slot - Default is `MLOM`.
  * uri - Required for Static IPv4/IPv6.  Note: Must be FQDN is protocol is `HTTPS`

`iscsi_boot` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * interface_name

`iscsi_boot` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * port
  * slot

`local_cdd` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`local_cdd` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled - Default is `true`.

`local_disk` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`local_disk` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * slot - Default is `MSTOR-RAID`.

`nvme` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`nvme` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.

`pch_storage` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`pch_storage` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * lun - Default is `0`.

`pxe_boot` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * interface_source

`pxe_boot` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * interface_name - Required if `interface_source` is `name`.
  * ip_type - Default is `IPv4`.
  * mac_address - Required if `interface_source` is `mac`.
  * port - Required if interface_source is `port`.
  * slot - Default is `MLOM`.

`san_boot` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * interface_name
  * target_wwpn

`san_boot` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * lun - Default is `0`.
  * slot - Default is `MLOM`.

`sd_card` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * subtype - Default is `SDCARD`.

`sd_card` Optional Attributes:
  * bootloader
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
  * lun - Default is `0`.

`uefi_shell` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type

`uefi_shell` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled - Default is `true`.

`usb` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * subtype - Default is `usb-cd`.

`usb` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled - Default is `true`.

`virtual_media` Required Attributes:
  * device_name
  * device_type
  * subtype - Default is `kvm-mapped-dvd`.

`virtual_media` Optional Attributes:
  * enabled - Default is `true`.
boot_devices.title: boot_devices - Boot Devices - object_type: boot.DeviceBase

boot_mode.description:
Default is `Uefi`.  Sets the BIOS boot mode. UEFI uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) whereas Legacy mode uses the MBR partitioning scheme. To apply this setting, Please reboot the server.
  * `Uefi` - UEFI mode uses the GUID Partition Table (GPT) to locate EFI Service Partitions to boot from.
  * `Legacy` - Legacy mode refers to the traditional process of booting from BIOS. Legacy mode uses the MBR to locate the bootloader.
boot_mode.title: boot_mode

enable_secure_boot.description: Default is `true`.  If UEFI secure boot is enabled, the boot mode is set to UEFI by default. Secure boot enforces that device boots using only software that is trusted by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).
enable_secure_boot.title: enable_secure_boot

boot_order.boot_devices.description: Lists properties that are common to all device types. It serves as base class for other device types.
boot_order.boot_devices.title: boot_device

device_name.description: A name that helps identify a boot device. It can be any string that adheres to the following constraints. It should start and end with an alphanumeric character. It can have underscores and hyphens. It cannot be more than 30 characters.
device_name.title: device_name

device_type.description:
The Boot Order Type to Assign to the Boot Device.  Allowed Values are:
  * flex_mmc - UCS Standalone Only
  * http_boot
  * iscsi_boot
  * local_cdd
  * local_disk
  * nvme
  * pch_storage
  * pxe_boot
  * san_boot
  * sd_card
  * uefi_shell
  * usb
  * virtual_media
device_type.title: device_type

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Specifies if the boot device is enabled or disabled.
enabled.title: enabled

interface_name.description: The name of the underlying virtual ethernet interface used by the PXE or SAN boot device.
interface_name.title: interface_name

interface_source.description:
Default is `name` when `device_type` is `http_boot` or `pxe_boot`.  Lists the supported Interface Source for device. Supported values are:
  * `name` - Use interface name to select virtual ethernet interface.
  * `mac` - Use MAC address to select virtual ethernet interface.
  * `port` - Use port to select virtual ethernet interface.
interface_source.title: interface_source

ip_config_type.description:
Default is `DHCP` when `device_type` is `http_boot`.  The IP config type to use during the `http_boot` process. For DHCP configuration, the IP address, DNS server, netmask and gateway details are obtained from DHCP server. For static configuration, please provide the IP address, DNS server, netmask, and gateway details.
  * `DHCP` - The type of the IP config is DHCP.
  * `Static` - The type of the IP config is Static.
ip_config_type.title: ip_config_type

ip_type.description:
Default is `IPv4` when `device_type` is `http_boot` or `pxe_boot`.  The IP Address family type to use during the `pxe_boot` and `http_boot` process(s).
  * `IPv4` - The IPv4 address family type.
  * `IPv6` - The IPv6 address family type.
ip_type.title: ip_type

lun.description: Default is `1`.  The Logical Unit Number (LUN) of the device. For `san_boot` configuration to be deployed on a server with 1300 family of Cisco VIC adapters, the recommendation is for the boot LUN to be numbered as 0 to ensure that LUN is mounted as the first disk from which the server boots.
lun.title: lun

mac_address.description: The MAC Address of the underlying virtual ethernet interface used by `http_boot` and `pxe_boot` when `interface_source` is `mac`.
mac_address.title: mac_address

port.description: `iscsi_boot` can be 0-255.  `pxe_boot` is the Port ID of the adapter and values can be between -1 (not defined) and 255.
port.title: port

protocol.description:
Default is `HTTPS` when `device_type` is `http_boot`.  Protocol to be used for HTTP boot. HTTPS require root certificate for authentication.
  * `HTTPS` - Secure HTTP protocol, certificate required for authentication.
  * `HTTP` - HTTP protocol without security certificate requirement.
protocol.title: protocol

slot.description: Options for `iscsi_boot`, `pxe_boot` and `san_boot` are 1-255, MLOM, L1, L2.  `scsi_boot` and `pxe_boot` also support L and OCP.  For `local_disk` values can be 1-205, FMEZZ1-SAS, HBA, M, MRAID, MRAID1, MRAID2, MSTOR-RAID, SAS, RAID.
slot.title: slot

subtype.description:
The subtype for the selected device type.

The Following Boot Order Device Types utilize the defined Subtype Attribute:

flex_mmc - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * `None` - No sub type for FlexMMC boot device.
  * `flexmmc-mapped-dvd` - Use of FlexMMC DVD as subtype for embedded storage.
  * `flexmmc-mapped-hdd` - Use of FlexMMC HDD as subtype for embedded storage.

sd_card - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-util - Use of FlexUtil (microSD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * flex-flash - Use of FlexFlash (SD) card as sub type for SD card boot device.
  * SDCARD - Use of SD card as sub type for the SD Card boot device.

usb - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for USB boot device.
  * usb-cd - Use of Compact Disk (CD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-fdd - Use of Floppy Disk Drive (FDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.
  * usb-hdd - Use of Hard Disk Drive (HDD) as sub-type for the USB boot device.

virtual_media - Below are the Supported Subtype Values:
  * None - No sub type for virtual media.
  * cimc-mapped-dvd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual DVD device.
  * cimc-mapped-hdd - The virtual media device is mapped to a virtual HDD device.
  * kvm-mapped-dvd - A KVM mapped DVD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-fdd - A KVM mapped FDD virtual media device.
  * kvm-mapped-hdd - A KVM mapped HDD virtual media device.
subtype.title: subtype

target_wwpn.description: The WWPN Address of the Target fibre channel interface used by the SAN boot device. Value must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
target_wwpn.title: target_wwpn

uri.description: Must be FQDN if `protocol` is `HTTPS`.  Boot resource location in URI format.  Required if device_type is `http_boot` and ip_config_type is `Static`.
uri.title: uri

boot_order.boot_devices.boot_loader.description: Details of the bootloader to be used.
boot_order.boot_devices.boot_loader.title: bootloader - Boot Loader Parameters

description.description:
Carries more information about the bootloader.  Optional for Uefi.

Required Attributes:
  * name
  * path

Optional Attributes:
  * description
description.title: description

name.description: Name of the bootloader image.  Optional for Uefi.
name.title: name

path.description: Path to the bootloader image.  Optional for Uefi, used by boot.Iscsi, boot.LocalDisk, boot.Nvme, boot.PchStorage, boot.San, boot.SdCard
path.title: path

boot_order.boot_devices.ipv4_config.description:
Http Boot Static IPv4 Settings.  Options are:
  * dns_ip
  * gateway_ip
  * network_mask
  * static_ip
boot_order.boot_devices.ipv4_config.title: ipv4_config - Http Boot Static IPv4 Configuration.

dns_ip.description: IP address for the DNS server.  Example `208.67.220.220`.
dns_ip.title: dns_ip

gateway_ip.description: IP address of the default gateway.  Example `198.18.0.1`.
gateway_ip.title: gateway_ip

network_mask.description: Network mask for IPv4 Static Configuration.  Example `255.255.255.0`.
network_mask.title: network_mask

boot_order.boot_devices.ipv6_config.description:
Http Boot Static IPv6 Settings.  Options are:
  * dns_ip
  * gateway_ip
  * prefix_length
  * static_ip
boot_order.boot_devices.ipv6_config.title: ipv6_config - Http Boot Static IPv6 Configuration.

dns_ip.description: IP address for the DNS server.  Example `2620:119:53::53`.
dns_ip.title: dns_ip

gateway_ip.description: IP address of the default gateway.  Example `2001:db8::1`.
gateway_ip.title: gateway_ip

prefix_length.description: A prefix length which masks the IP address and divides the IP address into network address and host address.  Example `255.255.255.0`.
prefix_length.title: prefix_length

certificate_management.description: Certificate Management policy models a reusable certificate and private key configuration that can be applied to multiple servers via profile association.
certificate_management.title: certificate_management - Certificate Management - Intersight Uri: certificatemanagement/Policies

allOf.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'certificatemanagement.Policy', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
allOf.title: certificate_management

assigned_sensitive_data.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to confirm that you have set the file location of the PEM Certificate File.  If false the Drive Security Policy will not run.
assigned_sensitive_data.title: assigned_sensitive_data

certificates.description:
List of Certificates and their Properties.  Each certificate policy can only have one IMC certificate.  Multiple RootCA certificates are supported for each policy.

IMC Certificate Required Attributes are:
  * type
  * variable_id

Note: The variable_id must be equal to `var.cert_mgmt_certificate_<variable_id>` and `var.cert_mgmt_private_key_<variable_id>`

IMC Certificate Optional Attributes:
  * cert_type: KMIPClient - Set KMIP certificate on the selected end point
  * enabled

RootCA Certificate Required Attributes are:
  * type
  * name
  * variable_id

Note: The variable_id must be equal to `var.cert_mgmt_certificate_<variable_id>`

RootCA Certificate Optional Attributes:
  * enabled
certificates.title: certificates

cert_type.description:
Default is `None`.  Certificate Type for the certificate management.
  * `None` - Set certificate on the selected end point .
  * `KMIPClient` - Set KMIP certificate on the selected end point.
cert_type.title: cert_type

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enable/Disable the certificate in Certificate Management policy.
enabled.title: enabled

name.description: Default is `true`.  Enable/Disable the certificate in Certificate Management policy.
name.title: name

type.description:
Default is `IMC`.  Certificate Object Type to Assign.
  * `IMC` - Set the object_type to `certificatemanagement.Imc`.
  * `RootCA` -  Set the object_type to `certificatemanagement.RootCaCertificate`.
type.title: type

variable_id.description: Default is `1`.  The Sensitive Variable Identifier to be used with this Certificate. i.e. `var.cert_mgmt_certificate_1` and `var.cert_mgmt_private_key_1`, when the Type is `IMC` or just `var.cert_mgmt_private_key_1` for `RootCA` Type.
variable_id.title: variable_id

device_connector.description: Policy to control configuration changes allowed from Cisco IMC.
device_connector.title: device_connector - Device Connector - Intersight Uri: deviceconnector/Policies

allOf.description: Definition of the list of properties defined in 'deviceconnector.Policy', excluding properties defined in parent classes.
allOf.title: device_connector

configuration_from_intersight_only.description: Default is `true`.  Enables configuration lockout on the endpoint.
configuration_from_intersight_only.title: configuration_from_intersight_only

drive_security.description: The drive security policy models the KMIP server related configuration that can be applied on multiple servers. Storage controller encryption can be enabled through this policy using remote keys from a KMIP server.
drive_security.title: drive_security - Drive Security - Intersight Uri: storage/DriveSecurityPolicies

allOf.description: The drive security policy models the KMIP server related configuration that can be applied on multiple servers. Storage controller encryption can be enabled through this policy using remote keys from a KMIP server.
allOf.title: drive_security

drive_security.manual_key.description:
Definition of the list of properties defined in 'storage.LocalKeySetting', excluding properties defined in parent classes.

Required Attributes:
  * new_security_key_passphrase

Optional Attributes:
  * current_security_key_passphrase
drive_security.manual_key.title: manual_key - Drive Security -> Manual Key - object_type: storage.LocalKeySetting

current_security_key_passphrase.description: Default is `0`.  Current Security Key Passphrase which is already configured on the server. From the security context, the passphrase should be at least 8 characters long and should include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.  i.e. `var.drive_security_current_security_key_passphrase_1`.
current_security_key_passphrase.title: current_security_key_passphrase

new_security_key_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  New Security Key Passphrase to be configured on the server. From the security context, the passphrase should be at least 8 characters long and should include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.  i.e. `var.drive_security_new_security_key_passphrase_1`.
new_security_key_passphrase.title: new_security_key_passphrase

current_security_key_passphrase.description: Default is `0`.  Current Security Key Passphrase which is already configured on the server. From the security context, the passphrase should be at least 8 characters long and should include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.  i.e. `var.drive_security_current_security_key_passphrase_1`.

ethernet_adapter.description: An Ethernet adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. For each VIC Virtual Ethernet Interface various features like VXLAN, NVGRE, ARFS, Interrupt settings, and TCP Offload settings can be configured.
ethernet_adapter.title: ethernet_adapter - Ethernet Adapter - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthAdapterPolicies

allOf.description: An Ethernet adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. For each VIC Virtual Ethernet Interface various features like VXLAN, NVGRE, ARFS, Interrupt settings, and TCP Offload settings can be configured.
allOf.title: ethernet_adapter

adapter_template.description:
Name of a Pre-Configured Adapter Template.  Options are:
  * 16RxQs-4G
  * 16RxQs-5G
  * Linux
  * Linux-NVMe-RoCE
  * Linux-v2
  * MQ
  * MQ-SMBd
  * MQ-SMBd-v2
  * MQ-v2
  * SMBClient
  * SMBServer
  * Solaris
  * SRIOV-HPN
  * usNIC
  * usNICOracleRAC
  * VMware
  * VMwareNVMeRoCEv2
  * VMwarePassThru
  * VMware-High-Trf
  * VMware-v2
  * Win-AzureStack
  * Win-HPN
  * Win-HPN-SMBd
  * Win-HPN-SMBd-v2
  * Win-HPN-v2
  * Windows
adapter_template.title: adapter_template

enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering.description: Default is `false`.  Status of Accelerated Receive Flow Steering on the virtual ethernet interface.
enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering.title: enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering

enable_advanced_filter.description: Default is `false`.  Enables advanced filtering on the interface.
enable_advanced_filter.title: enable_advanced_filter

enable_ether_channel_pinning.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Ether Channel Pinning to combine multiple physical links between two network switches into a single logical link. Transmit Queue Count should be at least 2 to enable ether channel pinning.
enable_ether_channel_pinning.title: enable_ether_channel_pinning

enable_geneve_offload.description: Default is `false`.  GENEVE offload protocol allows you to create logical networks that span physical network boundaries by allowing any information to be encoded in a packet and passed between tunnel endpoints.
enable_geneve_offload.title: enable_geneve_offload

enable_interrupt_scaling.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Interrupt Scaling on the interface.
enable_interrupt_scaling.title: enable_interrupt_scaling

enable_nvgre_offload.description: Default is `false`.  Network Virtualization using Generic Routing Encapsulation Settings.
enable_nvgre_offload.title: enable_nvgre_offload

enable_precision_time_protocol.description: Default is `false`.  Status of Precision Time Protocol (PTP) on the virtual ethernet interface. PTP can be enabled only on one vNIC on an adapter.
enable_precision_time_protocol.title: enable_precision_time_protocol

enable_vxlan_offload.description: Default is `false`.  Status of the Virtual Extensible LAN Protocol on the virtual ethernet interface.
enable_vxlan_offload.title: enable_vxlan_offload

receive_side_scaling_enable.description: Default is `true`.  Receive Side Scaling allows the incoming traffic to be spread across multiple CPU cores.
receive_side_scaling_enable.title: receive_side_scaling_enable

uplink_failback_timeout.description: Default is `5`.  Uplink Failback Timeout in seconds when uplink failover is enabled for a vNIC. After a vNIC has started using its secondary interface, this setting controls how long the primary interface must be available before the system resumes using the primary interface for the vNIC.
uplink_failback_timeout.title: uplink_failback_timeout

ethernet_adapter.completion.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - Completion Queue resource settings.  Options are:
  * queue_count
  * ring_size
ethernet_adapter.completion.title: completion - Completion Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.CompletionQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is `5`.  The number of completion queue resources to allocate. In general, the number of completion queue resources to allocate is equal to the number of transmit queue resources plus the number of receive queue resources.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is `1`.  The number of descriptors in each completion queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_adapter.interrupt_settings.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - Interupt Settings.  Otpions are:
  * coalescing_type
  * interrupts
  * mode
  * timer
ethernet_adapter.interrupt_settings.title: interrupt_settings - Interrupt Settings - object_type: vnic.EthInterruptSettings

coalescing_type.description:
Default is `MIN`.  Interrupt Coalescing Type. This can be one of the following:- MIN  - The system waits for the time specified in the Coalescing Time field before sending another interrupt event IDLE - The system does not send an interrupt until there is a period of no activity lasting as least as long as the time specified in the Coalescing Time field.
  * `MIN` - The system waits for the time specified in the Coalescing Time field before sending another interrupt event.
  * `IDLE` - The system does not send an interrupt until there is a period of no activity lasting as least as long as the time specified in the Coalescing Time field.
coalescing_type.title: coalescing_type

interrupts.description: Default is `8`.  The number of interrupt resources to allocate. Typical value is be equal to the number of completion queue resources.
interrupts.title: interrupts

mode.description:
Default is `MSIx`.  Preferred driver interrupt mode. This can be one of the following:- MSIx - Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI) with the optional extension. MSI  - MSI only. INTx - PCI INTx interrupts. MSIx is the recommended option.
  * `MSIx` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism with the optional extension (MSIx). MSIx is the recommended and default option.
  * `MSI` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism that treats messages as interrupts.
  * `INTx` - Line-based interrupt (INTx) mechanism similar to the one used in Legacy systems.
mode.title: mode

timer.description: Default is `125`.  The time to wait between interrupts or the idle period that must be encountered before an interrupt is sent. To turn off interrupt coalescing, enter 0 (zero) in this field.
timer.title: timer

ethernet_adapter.receive.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - Receive Queue Settings.  Options are:
  * queue_count
  * ring_size
ethernet_adapter.receive.title: receive - Receive Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.EthRxQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is `4`.  The number of queue resources to allocate.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is `512`.  The number of descriptors in each queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_adapter.receive_side_scaling.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - Receive Side Scaling Settings.  Options are:
  * enable_ipv4_hash
  * enable_ipv6_extensions_hash
  * enable_ipv6_hash
  * enable_receive_side_scaling
  * enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash
  * enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash
  * enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash
  * enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash
  * enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash
ethernet_adapter.receive_side_scaling.title: receive_side_scaling - Recieve Side Scaling Hash Settings - object_type: vnic.RssHashSettings

enable_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the IPv4 address is used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv4_hash.title: enable_ipv4_hash

enable_ipv6_extensions_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, the IPv6 extensions are used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv6_extensions_hash.title: enable_ipv6_extensions_hash

enable_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the IPv6 address is used for traffic distribution.
enable_ipv6_hash.title: enable_ipv6_hash

enable_receive_side_scaling.description: Default is `true`.  Receive Side Scaling allows the incoming traffic to be spread across multiple CPU cores.
enable_receive_side_scaling.title: enable_receive_side_scaling

enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, both the IPv4 address and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv4_hash

enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 extensions and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv6_extensions_hash

enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 address and TCP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash.title: enable_tcp_and_ipv6_hash

enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv4 address and UDP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash.title: enable_udp_and_ipv4_hash

enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash.description: Default is `false`.  When enabled, both the IPv6 address and UDP port number are used for traffic distribution.
enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash.title: enable_udp_and_ipv6_hash

ethernet_adapter.roce_settings.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - RoCE Settings.  Options are:
  * class_of_service
  * enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet
  * memory_regions
  * queue_pairs
  * resource_groups
  * version
ethernet_adapter.roce_settings.title: roce_settings - ROCE Settings - object_type: vnic.RoceSettings

class_of_service.description:
Default is `5`.  The Class of Service for RoCE on this virtual interface.
  * `5` - RDMA CoS Service Level 5.
  * `1` - RDMA CoS Service Level 1.
  * `2` - RDMA CoS Service Level 2.
  * `4` - RDMA CoS Service Level 4.
  * `6` - RDMA CoS Service Level 6.
class_of_service.title: class_of_service

enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled sets RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) on this virtual interface.
enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet.title: enable_rdma_over_converged_ethernet

memory_regions.description: Default is `131072`.  The number of memory regions per adapter. Recommended value = integer power of 2.
memory_regions.title: memory_regions

queue_pairs.description: Default is `256`.  The number of queue pairs per adapter. Recommended value = integer power of 2.
queue_pairs.title: queue_pairs

resource_groups.description: Default is `2`.  The number of resource groups per adapter. Recommended value = be an integer power of 2 greater than or equal to the number of CPU cores on the system for optimum performance.
resource_groups.title: resource_groups

version.description:
Default is `1`.  Configure RDMA over Converged Ethernet (RoCE) version on the virtual interface. Only RoCEv1 is supported on Cisco VIC 13xx series adapters and only RoCEv2 is supported on Cisco VIC 14xx series adapters.
  * `1` - RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol Version 1.
  * `2` - RDMA over Converged Ethernet Protocol Version 2.
version.title: version

ethernet_adapter.tcp_offload.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - TCP Offload Settings.  Options are:
  * enable_large_receive_offload
  * enable_large_send_offload
  * enable_rx_checksum_offload
  * enable_tx_checksum_offload
ethernet_adapter.tcp_offload.title: tcp_offload - TCP Offload Settings - object_type: vnic.TcpOffloadSettings

enable_large_receive_offload.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the reassembly of segmented packets in hardware before sending them to the CPU.
enable_large_receive_offload.title: enable_large_receive_offload

enable_large_send_offload.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the CPU to send large packets to the hardware for segmentation.
enable_large_send_offload.title: enable_large_send_offload

enable_rx_checksum_offload.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the CPU sends all packet checksums to the hardware for validation.
enable_rx_checksum_offload.title: enable_rx_checksum_offload

enable_tx_checksum_offload.description: Default is `true`.  When enabled, the CPU sends all packets to the hardware so that the checksum can be calculated.
enable_tx_checksum_offload.title: enable_tx_checksum_offload

ethernet_adapter.transmit.description:
Ethernet Adapter Policy - Transmit Queue Settings.  Options are:
  * queue_count
  * ring_size
ethernet_adapter.transmit.title: transmit - Transmit Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.EthTxQueueSettings

queue_count.description: Default is `1`.  The number of queue resources to allocate.
queue_count.title: queue_count

ring_size.description: Default is `256`.  The number of descriptors in each queue.
ring_size.title: ring_size

ethernet_network.description: An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.
ethernet_network.title: ethernet_network - Ethernet Network - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthNetworkPolicies

allOf.description: An Ethernet Network policy determines if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic. You can specify the VLAN to be associated with an Ethernet packet if no tag is found.
allOf.title: ethernet_network

default_vlan.description: Default is `1`.  Native VLAN ID of the virtual interface or the corresponding vethernet on the peer Fabric Interconnect to which the virtual interface is connected. Setting the ID to 0 will not associate any native VLAN to the traffic on the virtual interface.
default_vlan.title: default_vlan

qinq_vlan.description: Default is `0`.  The VLAN ID for VIC QinQ (802.1Q-in-802.1Q) Tunneling.  Any value other than 0 will enable QnQ Tunneling.
qinq_vlan.title: qinq_vlan

vlan_mode.description:
Default is `ACCESS`.  Option to determine if the port can carry single VLAN (Access) or multiple VLANs (Trunk) traffic.
  * `ACCESS` - An access port carries traffic only for a single VLAN on the interface.
  * `TRUNK` - A trunk port can have two or more VLANs configured on the interface. It can carry traffic for several VLANs simultaneously.
vlan_mode.title: vlan_mode

ethernet_network_control.description: The features that are applied on a vethernet that is connected to the vNIC.
ethernet_network_control.title: ethernet_network_control - Ethernet Network Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkControlPolicies

action_on_uplink_fail.description:
Default is `linkDown`.  Determines the state of the virtual interface (vethernet / vfc) on the switch when a suitable uplink is not pinned.
  * `linkDown` - The vethernet will go down in case a suitable uplink is not pinned.
  * `warning` - The vethernet will remain up even if a suitable uplink is not pinned.
action_on_uplink_fail.title: action_on_uplink_fail

cdp_enable.description: Default is `false`.  Enables CDP on an interface.
cdp_enable.title: cdp_enable

lldp_enable_receive.description: Default is `false`.  Determines if the LLDP frames can be received by an interface on the switch.
lldp_enable_receive.title: lldp_enable_receive

lldp_enable_transmit.description: Default is `false`.  Determines if the LLDP frames can be transmitted by an interface on the switch.
lldp_enable_transmit.title: lldp_enable_transmit

mac_register_mode.description:
Default is `nativeVlanOnly`.  Determines the MAC addresses that have to be registered with the switch.
  * `nativeVlanOnly` - Register only the MAC addresses learnt on the native VLAN.
  * `allVlans` - Register all the MAC addresses learnt on all the allowed VLANs.
mac_register_mode.title: mac_register_mode

mac_security_forge.description:
Default is `allow`.  Determines if the MAC forging is allowed or denied on an interface.
  * `allow` - Allows mac forging on an interface.
  * `deny` - Denies mac forging on an interface.
mac_security_forge.title: mac_security_forge

ethernet_network_group.description: The allowed VLAN/s on an interface.
ethernet_network_group.title: ethernet_network_group - Ethernet Network Group - Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkGroupPolicies

allowed_vlans.description: Allowed VLAN IDs of the vnic or ethernet uplink. A list of comma seperated VLAN ids and/or VLAN id ranges.
allowed_vlans.title: action_on_uplink_fail

native_vlan.description: Default is `1`.  Native VLAN ID of the vnic or ethernet uplink. If the native VLAN is not a part of the allowed VLANs, it will automatically be added to the list of allowed VLANs.
native_vlan.title: native_vlan

qinq_vlan.description: Default is `0`.  The VLAN ID for VIC QinQ (802.1Q-in-802.1Q) Tunneling.  Any value other than 0 will enable QnQ Tunneling.
qinq_vlan.title: qinq_vlan

ethernet_qos.description: An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters additional controls can be specified like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
ethernet_qos.title: ethernet_qos - Ethernet QoS - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthQosPolicies

allOf.description: An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters additional controls can be specified like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.
allOf.title: ethernet_qos

burst.description: Default is `10240`.  The burst traffic, in bytes, allowed on the vNIC.
burst.title: burst

class_of_service.description: Default is `0`.  Class of Service to be associated to the traffic on the virtual interface.
class_of_service.title: class_of_service

enable_trust_host_cos.description: Default is `false`.  Enables usage of the Class of Service provided by the operating system.
enable_trust_host_cos.title: enable_trust_host_cos

mtu.description: Default is `1500`.  The Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) or packet size that the virtual interface accepts.
mtu.title: mtu

priority.description:
Default is `Best Effort`.  The priority matching the System QoS specified in the fabric profile.
  * `Best Effort` - QoS Priority for Best-effort traffic.
  * `FC` - QoS Priority for FC traffic.
  * `Platinum` - QoS Priority for Platinum traffic.
  * `Gold` - QoS Priority for Gold traffic.
  * `Silver` - QoS Priority for Silver traffic.
  * `Bronze` - QoS Priority for Bronze traffic.
priority.title: priority

rate_limit.description: Default is `0`.  The value in Mbps (0-10G/40G/100G depending on Adapter Model) to use for limiting the data rate on the virtual interface.
rate_limit.title: rate_limit

fc_zone.description: List of target path entries of storage arrays that are used to configure zones on the switch.
fc_zone.title: fc_zone - FC Zone - Intersight Uri: fabric/FcZonePolicies

fc_target_zoning_type.description:
Default is `SIMT`.  Type of FC zoning. Allowed values are SIST, SIMT and None.
  * `SIST` - `a.k.a - Single Initiator Single Target` The system automatically creates one zone for each vHBA and storage port pair. Each zone has two members.
  * `SIMT` - `a.k.a - Single Initiator Multiple Target` The system automatically creates one zone for each vHBA. Configure this type of zoning if the number of zones created is likely to exceed the maximum supported number of zones.
  * `None` - FC zoning is not configured.
fc_target_zoning_type.title: fc_target_zoning_type

targets.description:
List of target WWPN members that are part of the zone.

Required Attributes:
  * name
  * switch_id
  * vsan_id
  * wwpn
targets.title: targets - Fc Target Members - object_type: fabric.FcZoneMember

fc_zone.targets.description: SAN target or WWPN that is to be part of the FC zone.
fc_zone.targets.title: FcTargetMember

switch_id.description:
Unique identifier for the Fabric object.
  * `A` - Switch Identifier of Fabric Interconnect A.
  * `B` - Switch Identifier of Fabric Interconnect B.
switch_id.title: switch_id

vsan_id.description: VSAN with scope defined as Storage in the VSAN policy.
vsan_id.title: vsan_id

wwpn.description: WWPN that is a member of the FC zone.
wwpn.title: wwpn

fibre_channel_adapter.description: A Fibre Channel Adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
fibre_channel_adapter.title: fibre_channel_adapter - Fibre Channel Adapter - Intersight Uri: vnic/FcAdapterPolicies

allOf.description: A Fibre Channel Adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
allOf.title: fibre_channel_adapter

adapter_template.description:
Name of Pre-Configured Adapter Templates.  Options are:
  * FCNVMeInitiator
  * FCNVMeTarget
  * Initiator
  * Linux
  * Solaris
  * Target
  * VMware
  * Windows
  * WindowsBoot
adapter_template.title: adapter_template

error_detection_timeout.description: Default is `2000`.  Error Detection Timeout, also referred to as EDTOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that an error has occurred.
error_detection_timeout.title: error_detection_timeout

io_throttle_count.description: Default is `512`.  The maximum number of data or control I/O operations that can be pending for the virtual interface at one time. If this value is exceeded, the additional I/O operations wait in the queue until the number of pending I/O operations decreases and the additional operations can be processed.
io_throttle_count.title: io_throttle_count

lun_queue_depth.description: Default is `20`.  The number of commands that the HBA can send and receive in a single transmission per LUN.
lun_queue_depth.title: lun_queue_depth

maximum_luns_per_target.description: Default is `1024`.  The maximum number of LUNs that the Fibre Channel driver will export or show. The maximum number of LUNs is usually controlled by the operating system running on the server. Lun Count value can exceed 1024 only for vHBA of type 'FC Initiator' and on servers having supported firmware version.
maximum_luns_per_target.title: maximum_luns_per_target

resource_allocation_timeout.description: Default is `10000`.  Resource Allocation Timeout, also referred to as RATOV, is the number of milliseconds to wait before the system assumes that a resource cannot be properly allocated.
resource_allocation_timeout.title: resource_allocation_timeout

fibre_channel_adapter.error_recovery.description:
Fibre-Channel Adapter Policy - Error Recovery Settings.  Options are:
  * enable_fcp_error_recovery
  * io_retry_timeout
  * link_down_timeout
  * port_down_io_retry
  * port_down_timeout
fibre_channel_adapter.error_recovery.title: error_recovery - Error Recovery Settings - object_type: vnic.FcErrorRecoverySettings

enable_fcp_error_recovery.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Fibre Channel Error recovery.
enable_fcp_error_recovery.title: enable_fcp_error_recovery

io_retry_timeout.description: Default is `5`.  The number of seconds the adapter waits before aborting the pending command and resending the same IO request.
io_retry_timeout.title: io_retry_timeout

link_down_timeout.description: Default is `30000`.  The number of milliseconds the port should actually be down before it is marked down and fabric connectivity is lost.
link_down_timeout.title: link_down_timeout

port_down_io_retry.description: Default is `8`.  The number of times an I/O request to a port is retried because the port is busy before the system decides the port is unavailable.
port_down_io_retry.title: port_down_io_retry

port_down_timeout.description: Default is `10000`.  The number of milliseconds a remote Fibre Channel port should be offline before informing the SCSI upper layer that the port is unavailable. For a server with a VIC adapter running ESXi, the recommended value is 10000. For a server with a port used to boot a Windows OS from the SAN, the recommended value is 5000 milliseconds.
port_down_timeout.title: port_down_timeout

fibre_channel_adapter.flogi.description:
Fibre-Channel Adapter Policy - Error Recovery Settings.  Options are:
  * retries
  * timeout
fibre_channel_adapter.flogi.title: flogi - Fabric Login Settings - object_type: vnic.FlogiSettings

retries.description: Default is `8`.  The number of times that the system tries to log in to the fabric after the first failure. Allowed range is `0-4294967295`.
retries.title: retries

timeout.description: Default is `4000`.  The number of milliseconds that the system waits before it tries to log in again.
timeout.title: timeout

fibre_channel_adapter.interrupt_settings.description:
Fibre-Channel Adapter Policy - Interupt Settings.  Options are:
  * mode
fibre_channel_adapter.interrupt_settings.title: interrupt - Interrupt Settings - object_type: vnic.FcInterruptSettings

mode.description:
Default is `MSIx`.  The preferred driver interrupt mode. This can be one of the following:- MSIx - Message Signaled Interrupts (MSI) with the optional extension. MSI  - MSI only. INTx - PCI INTx interrupts. MSIx is the recommended option.
  * `MSIx` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism with the optional extension (MSIx). MSIx is the recommended and default option.
  * `MSI` - Message Signaled Interrupt (MSI) mechanism that treats messages as interrupts.
  * `INTx` - Line-based interrupt (INTx) mechanism similar to the one used in Legacy systems.
mode.title: mode

timeout.description: Default is `20000`.  The number of milliseconds that the system waits before it tries to log in again.
timeout.title: timeout

flow_control.description: Priority Flow Control setting for each port.
flow_control.title: flow_control - Flow Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/FlowControlPolicies

priority.description:
Default is `auto`.  Configure the Priority Flow Control (PFC) for each port to enable the no-drop behavior for the CoS defined by the System QoS Policy and an Ethernet QoS policy. If Auto and On is selected for PFC, the Receive and Send link level flow control will be Off.
  * `auto` - Enables the no-drop CoS values to be advertised by the DCBXP and negotiated with the peer.A successful negotiation enables PFC on the no-drop CoS.Any failures because of a mismatch in the capability of peers causes the PFC not to be enabled.
  * `on` - Enables PFC on the local port regardless of the capability of the peers.
  * `off` - Disable PFC on the local port regardless of the capability of the peers.
priority.title: priority

receive.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Link-level Flow Control configured in the receive direction.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
receive.title: receive

send.description:
Default is `Disabled`.  Link-level Flow Control configured in the send direction.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
send.title: send

imc_access.description:
Enables you to manage and configure your network through mapping of IP pools to the server profile. This policy allows you to configure a VLAN and associate it with an IP address through the IP pool address.  In-Band IP address, Out-of-Band IP address, or both In-Band and Out-of-Band IP addresses can be configured using IMC Access Policy and are supported on the following:
  * Drive Security, SNMP, Syslog, and vMedia policies
  * vKVM, IPMI, SOL, and vMedia policies using vKVM client
imc_access.title: imc_access - IMC Access - Intersight Uri: access/Policies

ipv6_address_configuration.description: Default is `false`.  This is only applicable to the `inband_ip_pool`.  This flag enables the use of IPv6 address for end-point access.

ipmi_over_lan.title: ipmi_over_lan - IPMI Over LAN - Intersight Uri: ipmioverlan/Policies

allOf.description: Intelligent Platform Management Interface Over LAN Policy.
allOf.title: ipmi_over_lan

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  State of the IPMI Over LAN service on the endpoint.
enabled.title: enabled

encryption_key.description: Default is `1`.  The Encryption Key Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.ipmi_key`.  The encryption key to use for IPMI communication. It should have an even number of hexadecimal characters and not exceed 40 characters. Use 00 to disable encryption key use. This configuration is supported by all standalone rack servers. FI-attached rack servers with firmware at minimum of 4.2.3a support this configuration. FI-attached blade servers with firmware at minimum of 5.1.0.x support this configuration. IPMI commands using this key should append zeroes to the key to achieve a length of 40 characters.
encryption_key.title: encryption_key

privilege.description:
Default is `read-only`.  The highest privilege level that can be assigned to an IPMI session on a server. This configuration is supported by all standalone rack servers. FI-attached rack servers with firmware at minimum of 4.2.3a support this configuration. FI-attached blade servers do not support privilege level. Privilege level will be ignored for unsupported servers.
  * `admin` - Privilege to perform all actions available through IPMI.
  * `user` - Privilege to perform some functions through IPMI but restriction on performing administrative tasks.
  * `read-only` - Privilege to view information throught IPMI but restriction on making any changes.
privilege.title: privilege

  * `None` - Type indicates that there is no IQN associated to an interface.
  * `Static` - Type represents that static IQN is associated to an interface.
  * `Pool` - Type indicates that IQN value is sourced from an associated pool.
iqn_allocation_type.title: iqn_allocation_type

iqn_pool.description: Default is IQN Pool to Assign to the Policy.
iqn_pool.title: iqn_pool

iqn_static_identifier.description: User provided static iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN) for use as initiator identifiers by iSCSI vNICs in a Fabric Interconnect domain.
iqn_static_identifier.title: iqn_static_identifier

target_platform.description:
Default is `FIAttached`.  The platform for which the server profile is applicable. It can either be a server that is operating in standalone mode or which is attached to a Fabric Interconnect managed by Intersight.
  * `Standalone` - Servers which are operating in standalone mode i.e. not connected to a Fabric Interconnected.
  * `FIAttached` - Servers which are connected to a Fabric Interconnect that is managed by Intersight.
target_platform.title: target_platform

vnic_placement_mode.description:
Default is `custom`.  The mode used for placement of vNICs on network adapters. It can either be Auto or Custom.
  * `custom` - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is manually chosen by the user.
  * `auto` - The placement of the vNICs / vHBAs on network adapters is automatically determined by the system.
vnic_placement_mode.title: vnic_placement_mode

cdn_source.description:
Default is `vnic`.  Source of the CDN. It can either be user specified or be the same as the vNIC name.

  * `user` - Source of the CDN is specified by the user.

enable_failover.description: Default is `false`.  Enabling failover ensures that traffic from the vNIC automatically fails over to the secondary Fabric Interconnect, in case the specified Fabric Interconnect path goes down. Failover applies only to Cisco VICs that are connected to a Fabric Interconnect cluster.
enable_failover.title: enable_failover

ethernet_network_group_policies.description: The Name(s) of the Ethernet Network Group Policy to Assign.  If it is a list of 1 then the policy will be used by all vNICs.  If the list is greater than 1, then the list must be an even number, and it will be split between the vNICs.

items.description: The Name of the Ethernet Network Group Policy to Assign.
items.title: ethernet_network_group_policy

ethernet_network_group_policies.title: ethernet_network_group_policies - Ethernet Network Group Policies

ethernet_network_policy.description: The Name of the Ethernet Network Policy to Assign to the vNIC.  This is for Standalone Only.
ethernet_network_policy.title: ethernet_network_policy

ethernet_qos_policy.description: The Name of the Ethernet QoS Policy to Assign to the vNIC.
ethernet_qos_policy.title: ethernet_qos_policy

items.title: iscsi_boot_policy

iscsi_boot_policies.title: iscsi_boot_policies - Iscsi Boot Policies - Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiBootPolicies

mac_address_pools.title: mac_address_pools - Mac Address Pools - Intersight Uri: macpool/Pools

mac_addresses_static.description:
A List of Static MAC Addresses to Assign to the vNIC's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

items.description:
The MAC address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
To ensure uniqueness of MACs in the LAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the
following MAC prefix 00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

lan_connectivity.vnics.placement.description:
Placement Settings for the virtual interface.

Required Attributes:
  * pci_order

Optional Attributes:
  * automatic_pci_link_assignment
  * automatic_slot_id_assignment
  * pci_links
  * slot_ids
  * switch_ids
  * uplink_ports
lan_connectivity.vnics.placement.title: placement - Placement Settings - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

automatic_pci_link_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `pci_links` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the PCI Link in a dual-link adapter. This option applies only to 13xx series VICs that support dual-link. If enabled, the system determines the placement of the vNIC/vHBA on either of the PCI Links.
automatic_pci_link_assignment.title: automatic_pci_link_assignment

automatic_slot_id_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `slot_ids` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the VIC slot ID. If enabled and the server has only one VIC, the same VIC is chosen for all the vNICs. If enabled and the server has multiple VICs, the vNIC/vHBA are deployed on the first VIC. The Slot ID determines the first VIC. MLOM is the first Slot ID and the ID increments to 2, 3, and so on.
automatic_slot_id_assignment.title: automatic_slot_id_assignment

pci_links.description: The PCI Link used as transport for the virtual interface. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1385 which has two.

items.description: Default is `0`.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is `0-3`.
items.title: pci_link

pci_links.title: pci_links - Pci Link - Object Type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_order.description: The order in which the virtual interface is brought up. The order assigned to an interface should be unique for all the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel interfaces on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. The order should start from zero with no overlaps. The maximum value of PCI order is limited by the number of virtual interfaces (Ethernet and Fibre-Channel) on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1340, VIC 1380 and VIC 1385 which have two.

items.description: Default is `0`.  PCI Order Assigned to the Interface. The order should start from zero with no overlaps, including LAN and SAN Policies.
items.title: pci_order

pci_order.title: pci_order - Pci Order

slot_ids.description: List of PCIe Slots where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.

items.description: Default is ``.  PCIe Slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
items.title: slot_id

slot_ids.title: slot_ids - Slot Ids - Object Type: vnic.PlacementSettings

switch_ids.description:
A List of the fabric port(s) to which the vNICs will be associated.

  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is `None` for a standalone server use-case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects.

items.description:
Default is `None`.  The fabric port to which the vNICs will be associated.

  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is `None` for a standalone server use-case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects.
items.title: switch_id

switch_ids.title: switch_ids - Switch Ids - Object Type: vnic.PlacementSettings

uplink_ports.description: Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  This attribute is for Standalone Servers Only.

items.description: Default is `0`.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is `0-3`.
items.title: pci_link

uplink_ports.title: uplink_ports - Uplink Port - Object Type: vnic.PlacementSettings

lan_connectivity.vnics.sriov.description:
Single Root Input Output Virtualization Settings that enable one physical ethernet socket to appear as multiple NICs to the hypervisor.

Note: If this is a vnic_from_template and Connection Settings (SR-IOV|usNIC|VMQ) have been configured in the template, you cannot configure with the vnic_from_template as well.

Required Attributes:
  * enabled

Optional Attributes:
  * completion_queue_count_per_vf
  * interrupt_count_per_vf
  * number_of_vfs
  * receive_queue_count_per_vf
  * transmit_queue_count_per_vf
lan_connectivity.vnics.sriov.title: sriov - SR-IOV Settings - object_type: vnic.SriovSettings

completion_queue_count_per_vf.description: Default is `5`.  Completion Queue resources per Virtual Function (VF).
completion_queue_count_per_vf.title: interrupt_count_per_vf

enabled.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled, sets Single Root Input Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) on this vNIC.
enabled.title: enabled

interrupt_count_per_vf.description: Default is `16`.  Interrupt Count resources per Virtual Function (VF).
interrupt_count_per_vf.title: interrupt_count_per_vf

number_of_vfs.description: Default is `64`.  Number of Virtual Functions (VF) to be created for this vNIC. Valid values are 1 to 64 when SR-IOV is enabled.
number_of_vfs.title: number_of_vfs

receive_queue_count_per_vf.description: Default is `4`.  Receive Queue resources per Virtual Function (VF).
receive_queue_count_per_vf.title: receive_queue_count_per_vf

transmit_queue_count_per_vf.description: Default is `1`.  Transmit Queue resources per Virtual Function (VF).
transmit_queue_count_per_vf.title: transmit_queue_count_per_vf

lan_connectivity.vnics.usnic.description:
User Space NIC Settings that enable low-latency and higher throughput by bypassing the kernel layer when sending/receiving packets.

Optional Attributes:
  * class_of_service
  * number_of_usnics
  * usnic_adapter_policy
lan_connectivity.vnics.usnic.title: usnic_settings - User Space NIC Settings - object_type: vnic.UsnicSettings

number_of_usnics.description: Default is `0`.  Number of usNIC interfaces to be created. Valid values are 1 to 255 when the usNIC is enabled. When the usNIC is disabled, the default value is `0`.
number_of_usnics.title: number_of_usnics

usnic_adapter_policy.description: Ethernet Adapter policy to be associated with the User Space vNICs.
usnic_adapter_policy.title: usnic_adapter_policy

lan_connectivity.vnics.vmq.description:
Virtual Machine Queue Settings for the virtual interface that allow efficient transfer of network traffic to the guest OS.

Optional Attributes:
  * enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue
  * enabled
  * number_of_interrupts
  * number_of_sub_vnics
  * number_of_virtual_machine_queues
  * vmmq_adapter_policy
lan_connectivity.vnics.vmq.title: vmq_settings - Virtual Machine Queue Settings - object_type: vnic.VmqSettings

enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue.description: Default is `false`.  Enables Virtual Machine Multi-Queue feature on the virtual interface. VMMQ allows configuration of multiple I/O queues for a single VM and thus distributes traffic across multiple CPU cores in a VM.
enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue.title: enable_virtual_machine_multi_queue

enabled.description: Default is `false`.  Enables VMQ feature on the virtual interface.
enabled.title: enabled

number_of_interrupts.description: Default is `16`.  The number of interrupt resources to be allocated. Recommended value is the number of CPU threads or logical processors available in the server.
number_of_interrupts.title: number_of_interrupts

number_of_sub_vnics.description: Default is `64`.  The number of sub vNICs to be created.
number_of_sub_vnics.title: number_of_sub_vnics

number_of_virtual_machine_queues.description: Default is `4`.  The number of hardware Virtual Machine Queues to be allocated. The number of VMQs per adapter must be one more than the maximum number of VM NICs.
number_of_virtual_machine_queues.title: number_of_virtual_machine_queues

vmmq_adapter_policy.description: Ethernet Adapter policy to be associated with the VMQ vNICs. The Transmit Queue and Receive Queue resource value of VMMQ adapter policy should be greater than or equal to the configured number of sub vNICs.
vmmq_adapter_policy.title: vmmq_adapter_policy

lan_connectivity.vnics_from_template.description: Virtual Ethernet Interface with a Source Template.
lan_connectivity.vnics_from_template.title: vnics_from_template - Virtual Ethernet Interfaces with a vNIC Template - Intersight Uri: vnic/EthIfs

cdn_value.title: cdn_value

iscsi_boot_policy.description: The Name of the iSCSI Boot Policy to Assign to the vNIC.  Only define if the `Allow Override` flag is checked with the template.

mac_address_pool.title: mac_address_pool

The MAC address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
To ensure uniqueness of MACs in the LAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the
following MAC prefix 00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.
mac_address_static.title: mac_address_static

pin_group_name.title: pin_group_name

vnic_template.description: Name of the vNIC Template to use to create this vNIC.

lan_connectivity.vnics_from_template.pla.title: placement - Placement Settings - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

automatic_pci_link_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `pci_link` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the PCI Link in a dual-link adapter. This option applies only to 13xx series VICs that support dual-link. If enabled, the system determines the placement of the vNIC/vHBA on either of the PCI Links.
automatic_pci_link_assignment.title: automatic_pci_link_assignment

automatic_slot_id_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `slot_id` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the VIC slot ID. If enabled and the server has only one VIC, the same VIC is chosen for all the vNICs. If enabled and the server has multiple VICs, the vNIC/vHBA are deployed on the first VIC. The Slot ID determines the first VIC. MLOM is the first Slot ID and the ID increments to 2, 3, and so on.
automatic_slot_id_assignment.title: automatic_slot_id_assignment

pci_link.description: Default is `0`.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is `0-3`.
pci_link.title: pci_link

pci_order.description: Default is `0`.  PCI Order Assigned to the Interface. The order should start from zero with no overlaps, including LAN and SAN Policies.  Range is `0-256`.
pci_order.title: pci_order

slot_id.description: Default is ``.  PCIe Slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.
slot_id.title: slot_id

switch_id.description:
Default is `None`.  The fabric port to which the vNICs will be associated.

Note: This can only be configured if the Allow Override is configured at the Template Level

  * `A` - Fabric A of the FI cluster.
  * `B` - Fabric B of the FI cluster.
  * `None` - Fabric Id is `None` for a standalone server use-case where the server is not connected to Fabric Interconnects.
switch_id.title: switch_id

uplink_port.title: pci_link

allOf.description: LDAP Policy configurations.
allOf.title: ldap

enable_encryption.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled, the endpoint encrypts all information it sends to the LDAP server.
enable_encryption.title: enable_encryption

enable_group_authorization.description: Default is `false`.  If enabled, user authorization is also done at the group level for LDAP users not in the local user database.
enable_group_authorization.title: enable_group_authorization

enable_ldap.description: Default is `true`.  LDAP server performs authentication.
enable_ldap.title: enable_ldap

ldap_from_dns.description: This Array enables the use of DNS for LDAP Server discovery.

ldap_groups.description:
A List of LDAP Groups.

Required Attributes:
  * end_point_role
  * group_dn
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * domain
ldap_groups.title: ldap_groups - LDAP Groups - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapGroups
