A List of LDAP Provider Servers.

Required Attributes:
  * server

Optional Attributes:
  * port
  * vendor
ldap_servers.title: ldap_servers - LDAP Provider Servers - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapProviders

nested_group_search_depth.description: Default is `128`.  Search depth to look for a nested LDAP group in an LDAP group map.  Range is `1-128`.
nested_group_search_depth.title: nested_group_search_depth

user_search_precedence.description:
Default is `LocalUserDb`.  Search precedence between local user database and LDAP user database.
  * `LocalUserDb` - Precedence is given to local user database while searching.
  * `LDAPUserDb` - Precedence is given to LADP user database while searching.
user_search_precedence.title: user_search_precedence

ldap.base_settings.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.
  * Required Attributes:
  * domain

Optional Attributes:
  * base_dn
  * timeout
ldap.base_settings.title: BaseSettings

base_dn.description: Distinguished Name (DN) of the user, that is used to authenticate against LDAP servers.  An example would be `DC=example,DC=com`
base_dn.title: base_dn

domain.description: The LDAP domain that all users must be in.  An example would be `example.com`.
domain.title: domain

timeout.description: LDAP authentication timeout duration, in seconds.  Range is `0 to 180`.
timeout.title: timeout

ldap.binding_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.

Required Attributes:
  * bind_method

Optional Attributes:
  * bind_dn
ldap.binding_parameters.title: binding_parameters

bind_dn.description: Base Distinguished Name (DN). Starting point from where server will search for users and groups.  An example is `CN=admin,DC=example,DC=com`
bind_dn.title: bind_dn

bind_method.description:
Default is `LoginCredentials`.  Authentication method to access LDAP servers.
  * `LoginCredentials` - Requires the user credentials. If the bind process fails, then user is denied access.
  * `Anonymous` - Requires no username and password. If this option is selected and the LDAP server is configured for Anonymous logins, then the user gains access.
  * `ConfiguredCredentials` - Requires a known set of credentials to be specified for the initial bind process. If the initial bind process succeeds, then the distinguished name (DN) of the user name is queried and re-used for the re-binding process. If the re-binding process fails, then the user is denied access.'
bind_method.title: bind_method

password.description: Default is `1`.  The LDAP Binding Parameter Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.binding_parameters_password`.
password.title: password

ldap.ldap_from_dns.description:
DNS settings used to access LDAP Providers.

Required Attributes:
  * search_domain

Optional Attributes:
  * search_forest
  * source
ldap.ldap_from_dns.title: ldap_from_dns

search_domain.description: Domain name that acts as a source for a DNS query.  An example would be `example.com`.
search_domain.title: search_domain

search_forest.description: Forest name that acts as a source for a DNS query.  An example would be `example.com`.
search_forest.title: search_forest

source.description:
Default is `Extracted`.  Source of the domain name used for the DNS SRV request.
  * `Extracted` - The domain name extracted-domain from the login ID.
  * `Configured` - The configured-search domain.
  * `ConfiguredExtracted` - The domain name extracted from the login ID than the configured-search domain.
source.title: source

ldap.ldap_groups.title: ldap_groups - LDAP Groups - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapGroups

domain.description: LDAP server domain the Group resides in.  If this is not defined the base domain from `base_settings` will be used.
domain.title: domain

end_point_role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  The name of the end point role.
  * admin
  * readonly
  * user
end_point_role.title: end_point_role

group_dn.description: LDAP Group DN in the LDAP server database..  An example would be `CN=admin,OU=Users,DC=example,DC=com`
group_dn.title: group_dn

name.description: LDAP Group name in the LDAP server database.
name.title: name

ldap.ldap_servers.title: ldap_servers - LDAP Provider Servers - Intersight Uri: iam/LdapProviders

port.description: Default is `389`.  PLDAP Server Port for connection establishment.
port.title: port

server.description: LDAP Server Address, can be IP address or hostname.
server.title: server

vendor.description:
Default is `OpenLDAP`.  LDAP server vendor type used for authentication.
  * `OpenLDAP` - Open source LDAP server for remote authentication.
  * `MSAD` - Microsoft active directory for remote authentication.
vendor.title: vendor

ldap.search_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.Required Attributes:
  * attribute
  * filter
  * group_attribute
ldap.search_parameters.title: search_parameters

attribute.description: Default is `CiscoAvPair`.  Role and locale information of the user.
attribute.title: attribute

filter.description: Default is `sAMAccountName`.  Criteria to identify entries in search requests.
filter.title: filter

group_attribute.description: Default is `memberOf`.  Attribute that identifies the Groups to which an LDAP user belongs.
group_attribute.title: group_attribute

link_aggregation.description: A policy to configure the link settings for all the port channels (including LACP).
link_aggregation.title: link_aggregation - Link Aggregation - Intersight Uri: fabric/LinkAggregationPolicies

lacp_rate.description:
Default is `normal`.  Flag used to indicate whether LACP PDUs are to be sent 'fast', i.e., every 1 second.
  * `normal` - The expanded 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 108 ports.
  * `fast` - The standard 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 54 ports.
lacp_rate.title: lacp_rate

suspend_individual.description: Default is `false`.  Flag tells the switch whether to suspend the port if it didn’t receive LACP PDU.
suspend_individual.title: suspend_individual

link_control.description: A policy to configure the link settings for all the ports (including UDLD).
link_control.title: link_control - Link Control - Intersight Uri: fabric/LinkControlPolicies

admin_state.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Admin configured UDLD State for this port.
  * `Disabled` - Admin configured Disabled State.
  * `Enabled` - Admin configured Enabled State.
admin_state.title: admin_state

mode.description:
Default is `normal`.  Admin configured UDLD Mode for this port.
  * `normal` - Admin configured 'normal' UDLD mode.
  * `aggressive` - Admin configured 'aggressive' UDLD mode.
mode.title: mode

local_user.description: Enables creation of local users on endpoints.
local_user.title: local_user - Local User - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUserPolicies

allOf.description: Enables creation of local users on endpoints.
allOf.title: local_user - Local User - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUserPolicies

users.description:
List of users to add to the local user policy.

Required Attributes:
  * username
  * password

Optional Attributes:
  * enabled
  * role
users.title: users - Users - Intersight Uri: iam/EndPointUsers

local_user.password_properties.description:
Set password properties for endpoint users.

Optional Attributes:
  * always_send_user_password
  * enable_password_expiry
  * enforce_strong_password
  * grace_period
  * notification_period
  * password_expiry_duration
  * password_history
local_user.password_properties.title:
password_properties - Local User Policy Password Settings.
intersight_api: iam/EndPointPasswordProperties

always_send_user_password.description: Default is `false`.  User password will always be sent to endpoint device. If the option is not selected, then user password will be sent to endpoint device for new users and if user password is changed for existing users.
always_send_user_password.title: always_send_user_password

enable_password_expiry.description: Default is `false`.  Enables password expiry on the endpoint.
enable_password_expiry.title: enable_password_expiry

enforce_strong_password.description:
Default is `true`.  Enables a strong password policy. Strong password requirements:
  * A. The password must have a minimum of 8 and a maximum of 20 characters.
  * B. The password must not contain the User's Name.
  * C. The password must contain characters from three of the following four categories.
    - 1) English uppercase characters (A through Z). 2) English lowercase characters (a through z).
    - 3) Base 10 digits (0 through 9).
    - 4) Non-alphabetic characters (! , @, #, $, %, ^, &, *, -, _, +, =).
enforce_strong_password.title: enforce_strong_password

grace_period.description: Default is `1`.  Time period until when you can use the existing password, after it expires.
grace_period.title: grace_period

notification_period.description: Default is `15`.  The duration after which the password will expire.
notification_period.title: notification_period

password_expiry_duration.description: Default is `90`.  Set time period for password expiration. Value should be greater than notification period and grace period.
password_expiry_duration.title: password_expiry_duration

password_history.description: Default is `5`.  Tracks password change history. Specifies in number of instances, that the new password was already used.
password_history.title: password_history

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enables the user account on the endpoint.
enabled.title: enabled

password.description: Default is `1`.  The Local User Authentication Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.local_user_password_1`.
password.title: password

role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  The name of the end point role.
  * admin
  * readonly
  * user
role.title: role

username.description: Name of the user to be created on the endpoint. It can be any string that adheres to the following constraints. It can have alphanumeric characters, dots, underscores and hyphen. It cannot be more than 16 characters.
username.title: username

mac.description: Pool represents a collection of MAC addresses that can be allocated to VNICs of a server profile.
mac.title: mac - MAC Pools - Intersight Uri: macpool/Pools

mac_blocks.description:
A block of MAC addresses.

Required Attributes:
  * from

Optional Attributes:
  * size
  * to
Note: Only assign either size or to, not both.
mac_blocks.title: mac_blocks

from.description: Staring MAC Address.  An Example is `00:25:B5:0A:00:00`
from.title: from

size.description: Size of the Pool.  Allowed range is `1-1024`.
size.title: size

to.description: Ending MAC Address.  An Example is `00:25:B5:0A:04:00`
to.title: to

mac_sec.description: A placeholder for MACSec (Media Access Control Security) configuration parameters, Primary/Fallback key chain and EAPol (Extensible Authentication Protocol over LAN) configurations.
mac_sec.title: mac_sec - MacSec - Intersight Uri: fabric/MacSecPolicies

allOf.description: A placeholder for MACSec (Media Access Control Security) configuration parameters, Primary/Fallback key chain and EAPol (Extensible Authentication Protocol over LAN) configurations.
allOf.title: mac_sec - MacSec - Intersight Uri: fabric/MacSecPoliciess

chipher_suite.description:
Default is `GCM-AES-XPN-256`.  Cipher suite to be used for MacSec encryption.
  * `GCM-AES-128` - This Cipher Suite employs the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) with a 128-bit key in Galois/Counter Mode, offering both encryption and authentication.
  * `GCM-AES-256` - This Cipher Suite utilizes Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) with a 256-bit key in Galois/Counter Mode, offering a higher level of security compared to GCM-AES-128 due to the larger key size.
  * `GCM-AES-XPN-128` - An extended Cipher Suite of GCM-AES-128  used in MacSec (Media Access Control Security) that incorporates Extended Packet Numbering (XPN) to enhance security and scalability.
  * `GCM-AES-XPN-256` - An extended Cipher Suite of GCM-AES-256 used in MacSec (Media Access Control Security) that incorporates Extended Packet Numbering (XPN) for enhanced security and scalability.
chipher_suite.title: chipher_suite

confidentiality_offset.description:
Default is `CONF-OFFSET-0`.  The MacSec confidentiality offset specifies the number of bytes starting from the frame header. MacSec encrypts only the bytes after the offset in a frame.
  * `CONF-OFFSET-0` - A value of 0 means the entire ethernet frame is encrypted.
  * `CONF-OFFSET-30` - The first 30 bytes of the ethernet frame are not encrypted, and the rest of the frame is encrypted.
  * `CONF-OFFSET-50` - The first 50 bytes of the ethernet frame are not encrypted, and the rest of the frame is encrypted.
confidentiality_offset.title: chipher_suite

include_icv_indicator.description: Default is `false`.  Configures inclusion of the optional integrity check value (ICV) indicator as part of the transmitted MacSec key agreement protocol data unit (PDU).
include_icv_indicator.title: include_icv_indicator

key_server_priority.description: Default is `16`.  The key server is selected by comparing key-server priority values during MacSec key agreement (MKA) message exchange between peer devices. Valid values range from 0 to 255. The lower the value, the higher the chance it will be selected as the key server.
key_server_priority.title: key_server_priority

replay_window_size.description: Default is `148809600`.  Defines the size of the replay protection window. It determines the number of packets that can be received out of order without being considered replay attacks.
replay_window_size.title: replay_window_size

sak_expiry_time.description: Default value is undefined.  The key server is selected by comparing key-server priority values during MacSec key agreement (MKA) message exchange between peer devices. Valid values range from 0 to 255. The lower the value, the higher the chance it will be selected as the key server.
sak_expiry_time.title: sak_expiry_time

security_policy.description:
Default is `Should-secure`.  The security policy specifies the level of MacSec enforcement on network traffic passing through a given interface.
Should secure allows unencrypted traffic to flow until the MacSec key agreement (MKA) session is secured. After the MKA session is secured, the policy switches to only allow encrypted traffic to flow. Must secure imposes only MacSec encrypted traffic to flow. Traffic will be dropped, until the MKA session is not secured.
  * `Should-secure` - Should secure allows unencrypted traffic to flow until the MacSec key agreement (MKA) session is secured. After the MKA session is secured, the policy switches to only allow encrypted traffic to flow.
  * `Must-secure` - Must secure imposes only MacSec encrypted traffic to flow. Traffic will be dropped, until the MKA session is not secured.
security_policy.title: security_policy

mac_sec.eapol_configurations.description:
Extensible authentication protocol over LAN (EAPoL). MacSec transmits MacSec key agreement (MKA) protocol data units (PDUs) using EAPoL packets to establish a secure session.

Required Attributes:
  * ether_type
  * mac_address
mac_sec.eapol_configurations.title: EAPoL Configurations

ether_type.description: Default is `0x888e`.  Ethertype to use in extensible authentication protocol over LAN (EAPoL) frames for MacSec key agreement (MKA) protocol data units (PDUs). The range is between 0x600 - 0xffff.
ether_type.title: ether_type

mac_address.description: Default is `0180.C200.0003`.  MAC address to use in extensible authentication protocol over LAN (EAPoL) for MacSec key agreement (MKA) protocol data units (PDUs). EAPol mac address should not be equal to all-zero (0000.0000.0000).
mac_address.title: mac_address

mac_sec.mac_sec_fallback_key_chain.description:
Fallback key chain for managing an alternative set of security keys to be used when a secure session cannot be established using the primary key chain.

Required Attributes:
  * fallback_key_chain_name

Optional Attributes:
  * add_key
mac_sec.mac_sec_fallback_key_chain.title: mac_sec_fallback_key_chain - Fallback Keychain

add_key.description:
A collection of security keys used for encrypting and decrypting data frames to ensure secure communication between devices.

Required Attributes:
  * cryptographic_algorithm
  * id
  * secret

Optional Attributes:
  * key_lifetime
add_key.title: add_key - Add Key - Intersight Uri: fabric.SecKey

cryptographic_algorithm.description:
Default is `AES_256_CMAC`.  The cryptographic algorithm that employs the cipher-based message authentication code (CMAC) mode of operation with advanced encryption standard (AES).
  * `AES_256_CMAC` - Uses the AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) algorithm with a 256-bit key to generate a CMAC.
  * `AES_128_CMAC` - Uses the AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) algorithm with a 128-bit key to generate a CMAC.
cryptographic_algorithm.title: cryptographic_algorithm

id.description: Must have an even number of hexadecimal characters (including 0-9 and A-F, only) with a length between 2 and 64 characters. For example, "10", "2000", "ABCD1234".
id.title: id

secret.description: Default is `1`.  The MacSec Key Secret Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.mac_sec_fallback_key_chain_secret_1`.
secret.title: secret

mac_sec.mac_sec_fallback_key_chain.add_k.description:
Key Lifetime attributes for the fallback key.

Required Attributes:
  * always_active

Optional Attributes:
  * end_time
  * start_time
  * timezone

Note:  If `always_active` is true the rest of the attributes are ignored.  If `always_active` is false, start_time is required.  If end_time is not defined when always_active is true the lifetime is set to infinite.
mac_sec.mac_sec_fallback_key_chain.add_k.title: Key Lifetime

always_active.description: Default is `true`.  Indicates that the key is always active. When this parameter is set, all other key lifetime configurations are ignored.
always_active.title: always_active

end_time.description: The time of day and date when the key becomes inactive.
end_time.title: end_time

start_time.description: The time of day and date when the key becomes active.
start_time.title: start_time

timezone.description:
Default is `UTC`.  The time zone used for key lifetime configurations.
* `Local` - The local time zone of the device for key lifetime configurations.
  * `UTC` - The Universal Time (UTC) for key lifetime configurations.
timezone.title: timezone

Primary key chain for managing the default set of security keys for encryption and decryption.

  * primary_key_chain_name

Optional Attributes:
  * add_key
mac_sec.mac_sec_primary_key_chain.title: mac_sec_primary_key_chain - Primary Keychain

A collection of security keys used for encrypting and decrypting data frames to ensure secure communication between devices.

  * `AES_256_CMAC` - Uses the AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) algorithm with a 256-bit key to generate a CMAC.
  * `AES_128_CMAC` - Uses the AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) algorithm with a 128-bit key to generate a CMAC.
cryptographic_algorithm.title: cryptographic_algorithm

organizations.description: Organization provides multi-tenancy within an account. Multiple organizations can be present under an account. Resources are associated to organization using resource groups. Organization can have heterogeneous resources. Resources can be shared among multiple organizations. Organizations are associated to user permissions and privileges can be specified to provide access control. User can have access to multiple organizations in same permission and with different privileges on each organization.
organizations.title: organizations - Intersight Uri: organization/Organizations

allOf.description: Organization provides multi-tenancy within an account. Multiple organizations can be present under an account. Resources are associated to organization using resource groups. Organization can have heterogeneous resources. Resources can be shared among multiple organizations. Organizations are associated to user permissions and privileges can be specified to provide access control. User can have access to multiple organizations in same permission and with different privileges on each organization.
allOf.title: organization - Intersight Uri: organization/Organizations

create_organization.description: Default is `false`.  Flag to tell the script to Create the organization with the same name as the Organization.
create_organization.title: create_organization

description.description: The informative description about the usage of this organization.
description.title: description

organizations_to_share_with.description: List of Organization(s) to Add to a Shared Organization.

items.description: Organization to Add to a Shared Organization.
items.title: organization

organizations_to_share_with.title: organizations_to_share_with

resource_groups.description:
A List of Resource Groups to Assign to the Organization.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * resources.
resource_groups.title: resource_groups

persistent_memory.description: The Persistent Memory policy defines the reusable Persistent Memory related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows the application of Persistent Memory Goals and creation of Persistent Memory Regions and Namespaces. The encryption of the Persistent Memory Modules can be enabled through this policy by providing a passphrase.
persistent_memory.title: persistent_memory - Persistent Memory - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryPolicies

allOf.description: The Persistent Memory policy defines the reusable Persistent Memory related configuration that can be applied on many servers. This policy allows the application of Persistent Memory Goals and creation of Persistent Memory Regions and Namespaces. The encryption of the Persistent Memory Modules can be enabled through this policy by providing a passphrase.
allOf.title: persistent_memory - Persistent Memory - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryPolicies

management_mode.description:
Default is `configured-from-intersight`.  Management Mode of the policy. This can be either Configured from Intersight or Configured from Operating System.
  * `configured-from-intersight` - The Persistent Memory Modules are configured from Intersight thorugh Persistent Memory policy.
  * `configured-from-operating-system` - The Persistent Memory Modules are configured from operating system thorugh OS tools.
management_mode.title: management_mode

namespaces.description:
The list of Persistent Memory Namespace spec that need to be created through this policy.  Namespace is a partition made in one or more Persistent Memory Regions. You can create a namespace in Raw or Block mode.
Required Attributes are:
  * capacity
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * mode
  * socket_id
  * socket_memory_id
namespaces.title: namespaces - Persistent Memory Logical Namespaces - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryLogicalNamespaces

passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  The Persisentent Memory Passphrase Sensitive Variable Identifier.  i.e. `var.persistent_passphrase`.
passphrase.title: passphrase

retain_namespaces.description: Default is `true`.  Persistent Memory Namespaces to be retained or not.
retain_namespaces.title: retain_namespaces

persistent_memory.goal.description:
A Persistent Memory Goal that needs to be applied on the associated servers through the policy. This would result in the creation of regions and allocation of volatile memory on the server.

Required Attributes:
  * memory_mode_percentage
  * persistent_memory_type
persistent_memory.goal.title: goal - Persistent Memory Goal - Intersight Uri: memory/PersistentMemoryGoals

persistent_memory_type.description:
Type of the Persistent Memory configuration where the Persistent Memory Modules are combined in an interleaved set or not.
  * `app-direct` - The App Direct interleaved Persistent Memory type.
  * `app-direct-non-interleaved` - The App Direct non-interleaved Persistent Memory type.
persistent_memory_type.title: persistent_memory_type

persistent_memory.namespaces.description: Persistent Memory Namespace specification that needs to be applied to the associated servers through this policy. This would result in the creation, modification, or deletion of a Namespace on the servers.
persistent_memory.namespaces.title: namespaces - Persistent Memory Logical Namespaces

capacity.description: Default is `1`.  Capacity of this Namespace that is created or modified.
capacity.title: capacity

mode.description:
Default is `raw`.  Mode of this Namespace that is created or modified.
  * `raw` - The raw mode of Persistent Memory Namespace.
  * `block` - The block mode of Persistent Memory Namespace.
mode.title: mode

name.description: Name of this Namespace to be created on the server.
name.title: name

socket_id.description:
Default is `1`.  Socket ID of the region on which this Namespace has to be created or modified.
  * `1` - The first CPU socket in a server.
  * `2` - The second CPU socket in a server.
  * `3` - The third CPU socket in a server.
  * `4` - The fourth CPU socket in a server.
socket_id.title: socket_id

socket_memory_id.description:
Default is `2`.  Socket Memory ID of the region on which this Namespace has to be created or modified.
  * `Not Applicable` - The socket memory ID is not applicable if app-direct persistent memory type is selected in the goal.
  * `2` - The second socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `4` - The fourth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `6` - The sixth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `8` - The eighth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `10` - The tenth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
  * `12` - The twelfth socket memory ID within a socket in a server.
socket_memory_id.title: socket_memory_id

policies.description:
Policies in Cisco Intersight provide different configurations for UCS servers, including BIOS settings, firmware versions, disk group creation, Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP), Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) settings, and more. A policy that is once configured can be assigned to any number of servers to provide a configuration baseline. Policies in Cisco Intersight are native to the application and are not directly imported from the UCS Systems. Policy-based configuration with Server Profiles is a Cisco Intersight Essentials functionality.
Options are:

  * adapter_configuration
  * bios
  * boot_order
  * certificate_management
  * drive_security
  * device_connector
  * ethernet_adapter
  * ethernet_network
  * ethernet_network_control
  * ethernet_network_group
  * ethernet_qos
  * fc_zone
  * fibre_channel_adapter
  * fibre_channel_network
  * fibre_channel_qos
  * firmware
  * flow_control
  * imc_access
  * ipmi_over_lan
  * iscsi_adapter
  * iscsi_boot
  * iscsi_static_target
  * lan_connectivity
  * ldap
  * link_aggregation
  * link_control
  * local_user
  * mac_sec
  * multicast
  * name_prefix
  * name_suffix
  * network_connectivity
  * ntp
  * persistent_memory
  * port
  * power
  * san_connectivity
  * sd_card
  * server_pool_qualification
  * serial_over_lan
  * smtp
  * snmp
  * ssh
  * storage
  * switch_control
  * syslog
  * system_qos
  * thermal
  * virtual_kvm
  * virtual_media
  * vlan
  * vsan

adapter_configuration.description:
An Adapter Configuration Policy configures the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel settings for the Virtual Interface Card (VIC) adapter..

Required Attributes:
  * add_vic_adapter_configuration
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
adapter_configuration.title: adapter_configuration - Adapter Configuration - Intersight Uri: adapter/ConfigPolicies

bios.description:
A BIOS policy automates the configuration of BIOS settings on servers. You can create one or more BIOS policies that contain a specific grouping of BIOS settings, matching the needs of a server or a set of servers. If you do not specify a BIOS policy for a server, the BIOS settings will default to set of values for a brand new baremetal server or to a set of values previously configured using Cisco IMC. If a BIOS policy is specified, its values replace any previously configured values on the server.
All BIOS tokens are not applicable to all servers. If unsupported tokens are pushed to a server, those tokens are ignored.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: bios_template

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags

boot_order.description:
The Boot Order policy configures the linear ordering of devices and enables you to change the boot order and boot mode. You can also add multiple devices under various device types, rearrange the boot order, and set parameters for each boot device type.

  * enable_secure_boot
  * name

  * description
  * tags

certificate_management.description:
Allows you to specify the certificate and private key-pair details for an external certificate.
Note: Currently, Cisco Intersight supports Certificate Management of IMC Certificates only.

  * certificate
  * name

device_connector.description:
Device Connector Policy lets you choose the Configuration from Intersight only option to control configuration changes allowed from Cisco IMC. The Configuration from Intersight only option is enabled by default. You will observe the following changes when you deploy the Device Connector policy in Intersight:
  * Validation tasks will fail:
    * If Intersight Read-only mode is enabled in the claimed device.
    * If the firmware version of the Cisco UCS Standalone C-Series Servers is lower than 4.0(1).
  * If Intersight Read-only mode is enabled, firmware upgrades will be successful only when performed from Intersight. Firmware upgrade performed locally from Cisco IMC will fail.
  * IPMI over LAN privileges will be reset to read-only level if Configuration from Intersight only is enabled through the Device Connector policy, or if the same configuration is enabled in the Device Connector in Cisco IMC.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * configuration_from_intersight_only
  * description
  * tags
device_connector.title: device_connector - Device Connector - Intersight Uri: deviceconnector/Policies

drive_security.description:
In Intersight Managed Mode, the Drive Security Policy allows you to specify the KMIP server details and attach the policy to the server profile.

Required Attributes:

Optional Attributes:

  * manual_key
  * remote_key_management
  * tags
drive_security.title: drive_security - Drive Security - Intersight Uri: storage/DriveSecurityPolicies

ethernet_adapter.description:
An Ethernet adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. For each VIC Virtual Ethernet Interface, you can configure various features like Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN), Network Virtualization using Generic Routing Encapsulation (NVGRE), Accelerated Receive Flow Steering (ARFS), Interrupt settings, and TCP Offload settings.
The Ethernet Adapter policy include the recommended settings for the virtual Ethernet interface, for each supported server operating system. Operating systems are sensitive to the settings in these policies. In general, the storage vendors require non-default adapter settings. You can find the details of these required settings on the support list provided by those vendors.
IMPORTANT NOTE: If GENEVE Offload is Enabled be sure to Read the Following Guidance: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/Intersight/b_Intersight_Managed_Mode_Configuration_Guide/b_intersight_managed_mode_guide_chapter_0110.html#reference_ofm_khm_5jb

Required Attributes:
  * name

Recommended Attribute: adapter_template

Optional Attributes:
  * completion
  * description
  * enable_accelerated_receive_flow_steering
  * enable_advanced_filter
  * enable_ether_channel_pinning
  * enable_geneve_offload
  * enable_interrupt_scaling
  * enable_nvgre_offload
  * enable_precision_time_protocol
  * enable_vxlan_offload
  * interrupt_settings
  * receive
  * receive_side_scaling
  * roce_settings

  * uplink_failback_timeout

An Ethernet Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic. For certain adapters, you can also specify additional controls like burst and rate on the outgoing traffic.

fc_zone.description:
This policy allows you to set up access control between hosts and storage devices.
  * Certain points to be noted when creating the FC Zone policy:
  * Deploying a storage VSAN using a domain profile, for the first time, clears all the unmanaged zones from the Fabric Interconnect.
  * SAN boot targets with a storage VSAN have a zone entry in the Fabric Interconnect.
  * A one-time SAN boot with a storage VSAN has a zone entry in the Fabric Interconnect.
  * Editing the FC Zone policy causes the server profile status to be changed to Pending Changes.
  * When the Fabric Interconnect is rebooted, there is a replay of zones in the configuration.
  * Detection of configuration drift is not supported for FC Zone policy.

Required Attributes:
  * name
  * targets

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * fc_target_zoning_type
  * tags
fc_zone.title: fc_zone - Fc Zone - Intersight Uri: fabric/FcZonePolicies

fibre_channel_adapter.description:
A Fibre Channel adapter policy governs the host-side behavior of the adapter, including how the adapter handles traffic. You can enable FCP Error Recovery, change the default settings of Queues, and Interrupt handling for performance enhancement.
Note: We recommend that you use the values in these policies for the applicable operating system. Do not modify any of the values in the default policies unless directed to do so by Cisco Technical Support.

imc_access.description:
Enables you to manage and configure your network through mapping of IP pools to the server profile. This policy allows you to configure a VLAN and associate it with an IP address through the IP pool address.  In-Band IP address, Out-of-Band IP address, or both In-Band and Out-of-Band IP addresses can be configured using IMC Access Policy and are supported on the following:
  * Drive Security, SNMP, Syslog, and vMedia policies
  * vKVM, IPMI, SOL, and vMedia policies using vKVM client

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * inband_ip_pool
  * inband_vlan_id
  * inband_vlan_id
  * ipv4_address_configuration
  * ipv6_address_configuration
  * out_of_band_ip_pool
  * tags
imc_access.title: imc_access - Imc Access - Intersight Uri: access/Policies

ipmi_over_lan.description:
Defines the protocols for interfacing with a service processor that is embedded in a server platform. The Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) enables an operating system to obtain information about the system health and control system hardware and directs the Cisco IMC to perform the required actions. You can create an IPMI Over LAN policy to manage the IPMI messages through Cisco Intersight. You can assign these user roles to an IPMI user per session:
  * adminIPMI users can perform all available actions. If you select this option, IPMI users with the `Administrator` user role can create admin, user, and read-only sessions on this server.
  * read-onlyCan view information but cannot make any changes. IPMI users with the `Administrator`, `Operator`, or `User` user roles can only create read-only IPMI sessions, regardless of their other IPMI privileges.
  * user  IPMI users can perform some functions but cannot perform administrative tasks. If you select this option, IPMI users with the `Administrator` or `Operator` user role can create user and read-only sessions on this server.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * enabled
  * privilege
  * tags
ipmi_over_lan.title: ipmi_over_lan - Ipmi Over Lan - Intersight Uri: ipmioverlan/Policies

The iSCSI Adapter policy allows you to configure values for TCP Connection Timeout, DHCP Timeout, and the Retry Count if the specified LUN ID is busy.

Required Attributes:

Optional Attributes:

  * dhcp_timeout: 60
  * lun_busy_retry_count: 15
  * tags:
  * tcp_connection_timeout: 15

iscsi_boot.description:
iSCSI boot support allows you to initialize the Operating System on FI-attached blade and rack servers from a remote disk across a Storage Area Network. The remote disk, known as the target, is accessed using TCP/IP and iSCSI boot firmware.
Prerequisites - The following are required to configure the iSCSI boot device:
  * iSCSI Static Target Policy—When you select Static as the mode for configuring the iSCSI boot policy, you can use the iSCSI Static Target policy to specify the primary target details. You can also specify the details of a secondary target, if required.
  * iSCSI Adapter Policy—Using this policy you can specify the TCP and DHCP Connection Timeout and the retry count when the logical unit number of the boot device is busy.
  * Creating an IQN Pool—Using this policy you can specify the TCP and DHCP Connection Timeout and the retry count when the logical unit number of the boot device is busy.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * authentication
  * description
  * dhcp_vendor_id_iqn
  * initiator_ip_pool
  * initiator_ip_source
  * initiator_static_ipv4_config
  * tags
  * target_source_type
iscsi_boot.title: iscsi_boot - Iscsi Boot - Intersight Uri: vnic/IscsiBootPolicies

The iSCSI Static Target policy allows you to specify the name, IP address, port, and logical unit number of the primary target for iSCSI boot. You can optionally specify these details for a secondary target as well.

Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) stores and maintains directory information in a network. The NTP policy enables the NTP service to configure a UCS system that is managed by Cisco Intersight to synchronize the time with an NTP server. You must enable and configure the NTP service by specifying the IP/DNS address of at least one server or a maximum of four servers that function as NTP servers. When you enable the NTP service, Cisco Intersight configures the NTP details on the endpoint.

persistent_memory.description:
Persistent Memory Modules (PMem Modules) are non-volatile memory modules that bring together the low latency of memory and the persistence of storage. PMem Modules provide faster access to data and retain across power cycles, based on the mode. Intersight supports the configuration of Intel Optane PMem Module modules on the UCS M5 servers that are based on the Second Generation Intel Xeon Scalable processors. Intel Optane PMem Modules can be used only with the Second-Generation Intel Xeon Scalable processors. The Persistent Memory Policy allows the configuration of security, Goals, and Namespaces of Persistent Memory Modules.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * management_mode
  * memory_mode_percentage
  * namespaces
  * persistent_memory_type
  * retain_namespaces

  * power_priority

  * power_redundancy
  * power_restore
  * power_save_mode
  * processor_package_power_limit
  * tags
power.title: power - Power - Intersight Uri: power/Policies

san_connectivity.description:
Determines the network storage resources and the connections between the server and the SAN on the network. This policy enables you to configure vHBAs that the servers use to communicate with the Storage Area Network. You can use WWNN and WWPN address pools, or static WWNN and WWPN addresses to add vHBAs and to configure them. You must create the Fibre Channel Adapter, Fibre Channel QoS, and Fibre Channel Network policies as part of the SAN connectivity policy.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
  * target_platform
  * vhba_placement_mode
  * wwnn_pool
  * wwnn_static_address
  * vhbas
  * vhbas_from_template
san_connectivity.title: san_connectivity - San Connectivity - Intersight Uri: vnic/SanConnectivityPolicies

scrub.description:
The scrub policy models the data cleanup on the host. If scrub policy is associated, then its configuration will be used to initiate data erase during the server profile undeploy or disassociation.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * bios
  * description
  * disk
  * tags
scrub.title: scrub - Scrub - Intersight Uri: compute/ScrubPolicies

sd_card.description:
Configures the Cisco FlexFlash and FlexUtil Secure Digital (SD) cards for the Cisco UCS C-Series Standalone M4 and M5 servers. This policy specifies details of virtual drives on the SD cards. You can configure the SD cards in the Operating System Only, Utility Only, or Operating System + Utility modes.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description: ''
  * enable_diagnostics: false
  * enable_drivers: false
  * enable_huu: false
  * enable_os: false
  * enable_scu: false
  * tags:
sd_card.title: sd_card - Sd Card - Intersight Uri: sdcard.Policies

serial_over_lan.description:
Enables the input and output of the serial port of a managed system to be redirected over IP. You can create one or more Serial over LAN policies which contain a specific grouping of Serial over LAN attributes that match the needs of a server or a set of servers.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * baud_rate
  * com_port
  * description
  * enabled
  * ssh_port
  * tags
serial_over_lan.title: serial_over_lan - Serial Over Lan - Intersight Uri: sol/Policies

server_pool_qualification.description:
A server will be included in the resource pool if it matches the conditions of all the qualifiers present in the policy. The qualifiers are of four types:
  * Domain  All FI-attached servers in any domain that match the provided Fabric Interconnect PID and domain name qualify under this type.
  * Server  All blade and/or rack servers that match the provided server IDs, PIDs, tags, user labels, and chassis IDs qualify under this type.
  * Tag  All servers that match any of the provided server tags, domain profile, and chassis tags qualify under this type. Domain profile and chassis tags are applicable only for FI-attached servers.
  * Hardware  All servers with hardware components that match the provided CPU, memory, GPU, and Network adapters qualify under this type.

This policy is applicable for Intersight Managed Mode and Standalone servers.

Required Attributes:
  * `name`

Optional Attributes:
  * `description`
  * `domain_qualifiers`
  * `hardware_qualifiers`
  * `server_qualifiers`
  * `tag_qualifiers`
  * `tags`
server_pool_qualification.title: server_pool_qualification - Server Pool Qualification - Intersight Uri: resourcepool/QualificationPolicies

smtp.description:
Sets the state of the SMTP client in the managed device. You can specify the preferred settings for outgoing communication and select the fault severity level to report and the mail recipients.

Required Attributes:
  * mail_alert_recipients
  * name
  * smtp_server_address

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * enable_smtp
  * minimum_severity
  * smtp_alert_sender_address
  * smtp_port
  * tags
smtp.title: smtp - Smtp - Intersight Uri: smtp/Policies

snmp.description:
Configures the SNMP settings for sending fault and alert information by SNMP traps from the managed devices. Any existing SNMP Users or SNMP Traps configured previously on the managed devices are removed and replaced with users or traps that you configure in this policy. If you have not added any users or traps in the policy, the existing users or traps on the server are removed but not replaced.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * access_community_string
  * enable_snmp
  * description

  * snmp_engine_input_id

  * snmp_users
  * system_contact

  * tags
snmp.title: snmp - Snmp - Intersight Uri: snmp/Policies

ssh.description:
Enables an SSH client to make a secure, encrypted connection. You can create one or more SSH policies that contain a specific grouping of SSH properties for a server or a set of servers.

Required Attributes:

Optional Attributes:

  * enable_ssh

  * ssh_timeout
  * tags
ssh.title: ssh - Ssh - Intersight Uri: ssh/Policies

storage.description:
A Storage policy allows you to create drive groups, virtual drives, configure the storage capacity of a virtual drive, and configure the M.2 RAID controllers.

switch_control.description:
The Switch Control policy supports VLAN port count optimization, configuring MAC address aging time, and configuring Link Control Global settings.

  * vlan_port_count_optimization

syslog.description:
The Syslog policy defines the minimum severity as logging level from an endpoint. The policy also defines the target destination to store the Syslog messages, and the Hostname or the IP Address, the port information, and the communication protocol for the Remote Logging Servers.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * local_logging
  * remote_logging
  * tags

system_qos.description:
A System Quality of Service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic. This system class determines the quality of service for the outgoing traffic.

Optional Attributes:

  * configure_default_classes
  * configure_recommended_classes

thermal.description:
This policy enables controlling the speed of the server fans.

Required Attributes:
  * name

  * description
  * fan_control_mode
  * tags
thermal.title: thermal - Thermal - Intersight Uri: thermal/Policies

vhba_template.description:
A vNIC or vHBA template consists of common configurations that you can reuse across multiple vNICs or vHBAs, used in various Server Profiles. This approach simplifies network configuration across multiple servers. You can create vNICs or vHBAs from the template using the Derive operation while creating the policy. Additionally, you can attach an existing vNIC or vHBA to a template to utilize the configurations set in the template. These templates can be created with or without override options. The override option allows the configuration of the derived vNIC or vHBA to override the template configuration.

Required Attributes:
  * fibre_channel_qos_policy
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * allow_override
  * description
  * fc_zone_policies
  * fibre_channel_adapter_policy - required if allow_override is false
  * fibre_channel_network_policy - required if allow_override is false
  * persistent_lun_bindings
  * placement_switch_id
  * tags
  * vhba_type
  * wwpn_pool - required if allow_override is false
vhba_template.title: vhba_template - vHBA Template - Intersight Uri: vnic/VhbaTemplate

vlan.description:
VLAN policies create a connection to a specific external LAN. The VLAN isolates traffic to that external LAN, including broadcast traffic. You can create VLANs and Private VLANs using the VLAN policy.
Note: Ensure that each VLAN is associated with a multicast policy. You can edit the existing VLANs and associate them to a multicast policy. You cannot associate a Multicast policy to a Private VLAN.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
  * vlans
vlan.title: vlan - Vlan - Intersight Uri: fabric/EthNetworkPolicies

vnic_template.description:
A vNIC or vHBA template consists of common configurations that you can reuse across multiple vNICs or vHBAs, used in various Server Profiles. This approach simplifies network configuration across multiple servers. You can create vNICs or vHBAs from the template using the Derive operation while creating the policy. Additionally, you can attach an existing vNIC or vHBA to a template to utilize the configurations set in the template. These templates can be created with or without override options. The override option allows the configuration of the derived vNIC or vHBA to override the template configuration.

Required Attributes:
  * ethernet_network_control_policy
  * ethernet_network_group_policy
  * ethernet_qos_policy
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * allow_override
  * cdn_source
  * cdn_value

  * tags
  * usnic
  * vmq
vnic_template.title: vnic_template - vNIC Template - Intersight Uri: vnic/VnicTemplate

vsan.description:
With the Virtual SAN Identifier (VSAN) policy, you can create Virtual SANs (VSANs) to isolate devices physically connected to the same SAN fabric. VSANs improve security and stability in Fibre Channel fabrics and let you create several logical SANs over a common physical infrastructure.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * tags
  * uplink_trunking
  * vsans
vsan.title: vsan - Vsan - Intersight Uri: fabric.FcNetworkPolicies

 Options are:

pool.name.prefix_suffix.title: Pool Name Prefix/Suffix

default.title: default

ip.title: ip

iqn.description: A value to add to IQN pool names.
iqn.title: iqn

mac.description: A value to add to MAC pool names.
mac.title: mac

resource.description: A value to add to Resource pool names.
resource.title: resource

uuid.title: uuid

wwnn.description: A Prefix / Suffix to add to WWNN pool names.
wwnn.title: wwnn

wwpn.description: A Prefix / Suffix to add to WWPN pool names.
wwpn.title: wwpn

pools.description:
Pools are the basic building blocks for uniquely identifying hardware resources. As the basis for the UCS management model, they allow Service Profiles to be associated with any blade server, while still providing the exact same ID and presentation to the upstream LAN or SAN. If a pool is actively associated with a profile, the pool cannot be deleted.
Options are:

  * ip
  * iqn
  * name_prefix
  * name_suffix
  * resource
  * uuid
  * wwnn
  * wwpn

ip.description:
An IP pool is a sequential range of IP addresses within a certain network. You can assign multiple pool blocks within a pool configuration.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * ipv4_blocks
  * ipv4_configuration
  * ipv6_blocks
  * ipv6_configuration
  * tags
Note: For each Address Family IPv4/IPv6, both ipv(4|6)_blocks and ipv(4|6)_configuration must be defined.
ip.title: ip - IP Pool - ippool.Pool

iqn.description:
An IQN pool is a collection of iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) for use as initiator identifiers by iSCSI vNICs. IQN pool members are of the form prefix: suffix: number, where you can specify the prefix, suffix, and a block (range) of numbers.

Required Attributes:
  * iqn_blocks
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * prefix
  * tags
iqn.title: iqn - Iqn Pool - iqnpool.Pool

mac.description:
A MAC pool is a collection of network identities, or MAC addresses, that are unique in their Layer 2 environment and are available to be assigned to vNICs on a server. If you use MAC pools in server profiles, you do not have to manually configure the MAC addresses to be used by the server associated with the server profile.

Required Attributes:
  * mac_blocks
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * tags
mac.title: mac - MAC Pool - macpool.Pool

resource.description:
A resource pool is an aggregation of homogeneous resources that are managed in Intersight. A resource pool enables you to manage the utilization of resources for certain Intersight features like Server Profile. Currently, Intersight supports only server type as a resource for the resource pool.

Required Attributes:
  * name
  * serial_number_list

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * pool_type
  * resource_type
  * tags
resource.title: resource - Resource Pool - resourcepool.Pool

uuid.description:
A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) pool is a collection of UUIDs that are assigned to servers. The prefix and suffix of the UUID are variable values. A UUID pool ensures that these variable values are unique for each server associated with a server profile that uses a particular pool to avoid conflicts.

Required Attributes:
  * name
  * uuid_blocks

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * prefix
  * tags
uuid.title: uuid - UUID Pool - uuidpool.Pool

wwnn.description:
A WWNN pool is a WWN pool that contains only WW node names. If you include a pool of WWNNs in a server profile, the associated server is assigned a WWNN from that pool.

Required Attributes:
  * id_blocks
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * tags
wwnn.title: wwnn - WWNN Pool - fcpool.Pool

wwpn.description:
A WWPN pool is a WWN pool that contains only WW port names. If you include a pool of WWPNs in a server profile, the port on each vHBA of the associated server is assigned a WWPN from that pool.

Required Attributes:
  * id_blocks
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * assignment_order
  * description
  * tags
wwpn.title: wwpn - WWPN Pool - fcpool.Pool

pools.title: Intersight Pools

device_model.description:
Default is `UCS-FI-6454`.  This field specifies the device model that this Port Policy is being configured for.
  * `UCS-FI-6454` - The standard 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 54 ports.
  * `UCS-FI-64108` - The expanded 4th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 108 ports.
  * `UCS-FI-6536` - The standard 5th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 36 ports.
  * `UCS-FI-6664` - The standard 6th generation UCS Fabric Interconnect with 64 ports.
  * `UCSX-S9108-100G` - Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect 9108 100G with 8 ports.
  * `unknown` - Unknown device type, usage is TBD.

breakout_port_id.description:
Default is `0`.  Breakout port Identifier of the Switch Interface.
When a port is not configured as a breakout port, the aggregatePortId is set to 0, and unused.
When a port is configured as a breakout port, the 'aggregatePortId' port number as labeled on the equipment,
e.g. the id of the port on the switch.
breakout_port_id.title: breakout_port_id

port_id.description:
Default is `1`.  Port Identifier of the Switch/FEX/Chassis Interface.
When a port is not configured as a breakout port, the portId is the port number as labeled on the equipment,
e.g. the id of the port on the switch, FEX or chassis.
When a port is configured as a breakout port, the 'portId' represents the port id on the fanout side of the breakout cable.
port_id.title: port_id

slot_id.description: Default is `1`.  Slot Identifier of the Switch/FEX/Chassis Interface.

auto_negotiation.description: Default is `true`.  Auto negotiation configuration for server port. This configuration is required only for FEX Model N9K-C93180YC-FX3 connected with 100G speed port on UCS-FI-6536 and should be set as True.
auto_negotiation.title: auto_negotiation

breakout_port_id.description: Default is `0`.  Breakout port Identifier of the Switch Interface.  When a port is not configured as a breakout port, the aggregatePortId is set to 0, and unused.  When a port is configured as a breakout port, the 'aggregatePortId' port number as labeled on the equipment, e.g. the id of the port on the switch.
breakout_port_id.title: breakout_port_id

connected_device_type.description:
Device type for which preferred ID to be configured. If the actual connected device does not match the specified device type, the system ignores the 'PreferredDeviceId' property.
  * `Auto` - Preferred Id will be ignored if specified with this type.
  * `RackServer` - Connected device type is Rack Unit Server.
  * `Chassis` - Connected device type is Chassis.
connected_device_type.title: connected_device_type

device_number.description: Default is `1`.  Preferred device ID to be configured by user for the connected device. This ID must be specified together with the 'PreferredDeviceType' property. This ID will only takes effect if the actual connected device matches the 'PreferredDeviceType'. If the preferred ID is not available, the ID is automatically allocated and assigned by the system. If different preferred IDs are specified for the ports connected to the same device, only the preferred ID (if specified) of the port that is discovered first will be considered.
device_number.title: device_number

fec.description:
Default is `Auto`.  Forward error correction configuration for the port.
  * Auto - (Default).  Forward error correction option 'Auto'.
  * Cl91 - Forward error correction option 'cl91'.
  * Cl74 - Forward error correction option 'cl74'.
fec.title: fec

port_list.description:
A string containing the List of Ports to Configure.
In example: '1-5', '1,3,5', '1-5,10-16', or just '1'.
port_list.title: port_list

slot_id.description: Default is `1`.  Slot Identifier of the Switch/FEX/Chassis Interface.
slot_id.title: slot_id

power.description: Power Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Power Related Features.
power.title: power - Power - Intersight Uri: power/Policies

allOf.description: Power Management policy models a configuration that can be applied to Chassis or Server to manage Power Related Features.
allOf.title: power - Power - Intersight Uri: power/Policies

dynamic_power_rebalancing.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Dynamic Power Rebalancing mode of the Chassis. If enabled, this mode allows the chassis to dynamically reallocate the power between servers depending on their power usage. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
dynamic_power_rebalancing.title: dynamic_power_rebalancing

extended_power_capacity.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Extended Power Capacity of the Chassis. If Enabled, this mode allows chassis available power to be increased by borrowing power from redundant power supplies.  This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
extended_power_capacity.title: extended_power_capacity

power_allocation.description: Default is `0`.  Sets the Allocated Power Budget of the Chassis (in Watts). This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
power_allocation.title: power_allocation

power_priority.description:
Default is `Low`.  Sets the Power Priority of the Server. This priority is used to determine the initial power allocation for servers. This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `Low` - Set the Power Priority to Low.
  * `Medium` - Set the Power Priority to Medium.
  * `High` - Set the Power Priority to High.
power_priority.title: power_priority

power_profiling.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Power Profiling of the Server. If Enabled, this field allows the power manager to run power profiling  utility to determine the power needs of the server.  This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
power_profiling.title: power_profiling

power_redundancy.description:
Default is `Grid`.  Sets the Power Redundancy Mode of the Chassis/Server.  Redundancy Mode determines the number of PSUs the chassis keeps as redundant.  N+2 mode is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Grid` - Grid Mode requires two power sources. If one source fails, the surviving PSUs connected to the other source provides power to the chassis.
  * `NotRedundant` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements. No Redundant PSUs are maintained.
  * `N+1` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements plus one additional PSU for redundancy.
  * `N+2` - Power Manager turns on the minimum number of PSUs required to support chassis power requirements plus two additional PSU for redundancy. This Mode is only supported for UCS X series Chassis.
power_redundancy.title: power_redundancy

power_restore.description:
Default is `LastState`.  Sets the Power Restore State of the Server. In the absence of Intersight connectivity, the chassis will use this policy  to recover the host power after a power loss event.  This field is only supported for Cisco UCS X series servers.
  * `AlwaysOff` - Set the Power Restore Mode to Off.
  * `AlwaysOn` - Set the Power Restore Mode to On.
  * `LastState` - Set the Power Restore Mode to LastState.
power_restore.title: power_restore

power_save_mode.description:
Default is `Enabled`.  Sets the Power Save mode of the Chassis. If the requested power budget is less than available power capacity,  the additional PSUs not required to comply with redundancy policy are placed in Power Save mode. This option is only supported for Cisco UCS X series Chassis.
  * `Enabled` - Set the value to Enabled.
  * `Disabled` - Set the value to Disabled.
power_save_mode.title: power_save_mode

processor_package_power_limit.description:
Default is `Default`.  Sets the Processor Package Power Limit (PPL) of a server. PPL refers to the amount of power that a CPU can draw from the power supply. The Processor Package Power Limit (PPL) feature is currently available exclusively on Cisco UCS C225/C245 M8 servers.
  * `Default` - Set the Package Power Limit to the platform defined default value.
  * `Maximum` - Set the Package Power Limit to the platform defined maximum value.
  * `Minimum` - Set the Package Power Limit to the platform defined minimum value.
processor_package_power_limit.title: processor_package_power_limit

profiles.description:
Profiles in Cisco Intersight assign the Policy Configurations to UCS chassis/domains/servers, Policy-based configuration with Chassis/Domain/Server Profiles is a Cisco Intersight Essentials functionality.
Options are:
  * chassis
  * domain
  * name_prefix
  * name_suffix
  * server

chassis.description:
A UCS Chassis profile enables to create and associate chassis policies to an Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) claimed chassis. When a chassis profile is associated to a chassis, Cisco Intersight automatically configures the chassis to match the configuration specified in the policies of the chassis profile. The chassis-related policies can be attached to the profile either at the time of creation or later.

Important:
  * The chassis profile feature is available in Cisco Intersight only if:
     - You have installed the Cisco Intersight Essentials License.
     - You are either an Account Administrator or Server Administrator.
  * Policies that are attached to a chassis profile can be created ahead of creating a profile or during the creation of the profile.
  * If chassis polices are changed after deployment, the chassis profile will be set in Pending Changes state and you must manually re-associate the changed policies to chassis.
  * Chassis policies will be applied to both the input/output modules (IFMs/IOMs) in a chassis. The chassis policies association workflow will fail if the policy cannot be applied to one of the IFMs/IOMs.

Required Base Attributes:
  * action
  * attach_template
  * targets

Optional Base Attributes:
  * tags
  * ucs_chassis_profile_template

#=======================================
# Chassis Configuration
#=======================================
  * imc_access_policy
  * power_policy
  * snmp_policy
  * thermal_policy
chassis.title: chassis - Chassis Profiles - Intersight Uri: chassis/Profiles

domain.description:
A UCS Domain Profile configures a Fabric Interconnect pair through reusable policies, allows for configuration of the ports and port channels, and configures the VLANs and VSANs in the network. It defines the characteristics of, and configures ports on Fabric Interconnects. You can create a UCS Domain profile and associate it with a Fabric Interconnect Domain. The Domain-related policies can be attached to the profile either at the time of creation or later. One UCS Domain profile can be assigned to one Fabric Interconnect Domain.

Important:
  * You can use a single port policy per UCS Domain profile or a port-policy per FI.
  * Policies that are attached to a UCS Domain profile can be created ahead of creating a profile or during the creation of the profile.
  * Policies that are attached to a UCS Domain and the global policies of all UCS Domain Profiles associated with a specific UCS Domain are shared.

Required Base Attributes:
  * action
  * name
  * serial_numbers

Optional Base Attributes:
  * attach_template
  * description
  * tags
  * user_label
  * ucs_domain_profile_template - to assign to a template

#=======================================
# VLAN & VSAN Configuration
#=======================================
  * vlan_policies - required (If not attached to a domain template) - A list of one or two VLAN policies.  A list of one will assign the same policy to both fabrics.
  * vsan_policies - A list of one or two VSAN policies.  A list of one will assign the same policy to both fabrics.

#=======================================
# Ports Configuration
#=======================================
  * port_policies - required (If not attached to a domain template)

#=======================================
# UCS Domain Configuration - Management
#=======================================
  * certificate_management_policy
  * ldap_policy
  * network_connectivity_policy
  * ntp_policy
  * snmp_policy
  * syslog_policy

#=======================================
# UCS Domain Configuration - Network
#=======================================
  * switch_control_policy
  * system_qos_policy - required (If not attached to a domain template)
domain.title: domain - Domain Cluster Profile - Intersight Uri: fabric/SwitchClusterProfiles

server.description:
In Cisco Intersight, a Server Profile enables resource management by streamlining policy alignment, and server configuration. You can create Server Profiles using the Server Profile wizard or you can import the configuration details of C-series servers in standalone mode and FI-attached servers in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM), directly from Cisco IMC. You can create Server Profiles using the Server Profile wizard to provision servers, create policies to ensure smooth deployment of servers, and eliminate failures that are caused by inconsistent configuration. The Server Profiles wizard groups the server policies into the following four categories to provide a quick Summary View of the policies that are attached to a profile:
  * Compute Policies  BIOS, Boot Order, and Virtual Media.
  * Network Policies  Adapter Configuration, iSCSI Boot, LAN Connectivity, and SAN Connectivity policies.
     - The LAN Connectivity policy requires you to create Ethernet Network Policy, Ethernet Adapter Policy, and Ethernet QoS Policy. When you attach a LAN Connectivity policy to a server profile, the addresses of the MAC address Pool, or the static MAC address, are automatically assigned.
     - Note: A LAN Connectivity policy that has a static MAC address can be attached to only one server profile.
     - The SAN Connectivity policy requires you to create Fibre Channel Network Policy, Fibre Channel Adapter Policy, and Fiber Channel QoS Policy. When you attach a SAN Connectivity policy to a server profile, the addresses of the WWPN and WWNN Pools, or the static WWPN and WWNN addresses, are automatically assigned.
     - Note:  A SAN Connectivity policy that has a static WWPN, or a static WWNN can be attached to only one server profile.
  * Storage PoliciesSD Card and Storage policies
  * Management PoliciesDevice Connector, IPMI Over LAN, LDAP, Local User, Network Connectivity, SMTP, SNMP, SSH, Serial over LAN, Syslog, NTP, Certificate Management, and Virtual KVM policies

IMPORTANT:
  * The server profile feature is available in Cisco Intersight only if:
     - You have installed the Cisco Intersight Essentials License.

Required Base Attributes:
  * action
  * attach_template
  * targets
  * target_platform

Required for FIAttached when using pre-assignment under the targets:
  * domain_name

Optional Attributes:
  * detach_template
  * ignore_reservations
  * resource_pool
  * tags
  * ucs_server_template - For backward compatibility.  Use ucs_server_profile_template is preferred
  * ucs_server_profile_template

#=======================================
# Compute Configuration
#=======================================
  * bios_policy_policy
  * boot_order_policy
  * firmware_policy
  * persistent_memory_policy - Standalone Only
  * power_policy - FIAttached Only
  * thermal_policy
  * uuid_pool - FIAttached Only
  * virtual_media_policy

#=======================================
# Management Configuration
#=======================================
  * certificate_management_policy - FIAttached Only
  * device_connector_policy - Standalone Only
  * imc_access_policy - FIAttached Only
  * ipmi_over_lan_policy
  * ldap_policy - Standalone Only
  * local_user_policy
  * network_connectivity_policy - Standalone Only
  * ntp_policy - Standalone Only
  * serial_over_lan_policy
  * smtp_policy - Standalone Only
  * snmp_policy
  * ssh_policy - Standalone Only
  * syslog_policy
  * virtual_kvm_policy

#=======================================
# Storage Configuration
#=======================================
  * drive_security_policy
  * sd_card_policy
  * storage_policy

#=======================================
# Network Configuration
#=======================================
  * adapter_configuration_policy - Standalone Only
  * lan_connectivity_policy
  * san_connectivity_policy

vhba_type.description:
Default is `fc-initiator`.  vHBA Type configuration for SAN Connectivity Policy. This configuration is supported only on Cisco VIC 14XX series and higher series of adapters.
  * `fc-initiator` - The default value set for vHBA Type Configuration. Fc-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * `fc-nvme-initiator` - Fc-nvme-initiator specifies vHBA as a consumer of storage. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems.
  * `fc-nvme-target` - Fc-nvme-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables NVMe-based message commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. Currently tech-preview, only enabled with an asynchronous driver.
  * `fc-target` - Fc-target specifies vHBA as a provider of storage volumes to initiators. Enables SCSI commands to transfer data and status information between host and target storage systems. fc-target is enabled only with an asynchronous driver.
vhba_type.title: vhba_type

wwpn_static_addresses.description:
A List of Static WWPN Addresses to Assign to the vHBA's if the Allocation Type is set to STATIC.  The WWPN address must be in hexadecimal format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
Allowed ranges are 20:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 20:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or from 50:00:00:00:00:00:00:00 to 5F:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF.
To ensure uniqueness of WWN's in the SAN fabric, you are strongly encouraged to use the WWN prefix - 20:00:00:25:B5:xx:xx:xx.

  * pci_order

Optional Attributes:

  * slot_ids
  * switch_ids

san_connectivity.vhbas.placement.title: placement - Placement Settings - object_type: vnic.PlacementSettings

automatic_pci_link_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `pci_links` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the PCI Link in a dual-link adapter. This option applies only to 13xx series VICs that support dual-link. If enabled, the system determines the placement of the vNIC/vHBA on either of the PCI Links.
automatic_pci_link_assignment.title: automatic_pci_link_assignment

automatic_slot_id_assignment.description: Default is `true` if `slot_ids` is undefined, otherwise this is ignored.  Enable or disable automatic assignment of the VIC slot ID. If enabled and the server has only one VIC, the same VIC is chosen for all the vNICs. If enabled and the server has multiple VICs, the vNIC/vHBA are deployed on the first VIC. The Slot ID determines the first VIC. MLOM is the first Slot ID and the ID increments to 2, 3, and so on.
automatic_slot_id_assignment.title: automatic_slot_id_assignment

pci_links.description: The PCI Link used as transport for the virtual interface. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1385 which has two.

items.description: Default is `0`.  Adapter port on which the virtual interface will be created.  Range is `0-3`.
items.title: pci_link

pci_links.title: pci_links - Pci Link - Object Type: vnic.PlacementSettings

pci_order.description: The order in which the virtual interface is brought up. The order assigned to an interface should be unique for all the Ethernet and Fibre-Channel interfaces on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. The order should start from zero with no overlaps. The maximum value of PCI order is limited by the number of virtual interfaces (Ethernet and Fibre-Channel) on each PCI link on a VIC adapter. All VIC adapters have a single PCI link except VIC 1340, VIC 1380 and VIC 1385 which have two.

items.description: Default is `0`.  PCI Order Assigned to the Interface. The order should start from zero with no overlaps, including LAN and SAN Policies.
items.title: pci_order

pci_order.title: pci_order - Pci Order

items.description: Default is ``.  PCIe Slot where the VIC adapter is installed. Supported values are (1-15) and MLOM.

server_pool_qualification.description:
A server will be included in the resource pool if it matches the conditions of all the qualifiers present in the policy. The qualifiers are of four types:
  * Domain  All FI-attached servers in any domain that match the provided Fabric Interconnect PID and domain name qualify under this type.
  * Server  All blade and/or rack servers that match the provided server IDs, PIDs, tags, user labels, and chassis IDs qualify under this type.
  * Tag  All servers that match any of the provided server tags, domain profile, and chassis tags qualify under this type. Domain profile and chassis tags are applicable only for FI-attached servers.
  * Hardware  All servers with hardware components that match the provided CPU, memory, GPU, and Network adapters qualify under this type.

This policy is applicable for Intersight Managed Mode and Standalone servers.

Required Attributes:
  * name

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * domain_qualifiers
  * hardware_qualifiers
  * server_qualifiers
  * tag_qualifiers
  * tags
server_pool_qualification.title: server_pool_qualification - Server Pool Qualification - Intersight Uri: resourcepool/QualificationPolicies

allOf.description:
A server will be included in the resource pool if it matches the conditions of all the qualifiers present in the policy. The qualifiers are of four types:
  * Domain  All FI-attached servers in any domain that match the provided Fabric Interconnect PID and domain name qualify under this type.
  * Server  All blade and/or rack servers that match the provided server IDs, PIDs, tags, user labels, and chassis IDs qualify under this type.
  * Tag  All servers that match any of the provided server tags, domain profile, and chassis tags qualify under this type. Domain profile and chassis tags are applicable only for FI-attached servers.
  * Hardware  All servers with hardware components that match the provided CPU, memory, GPU, and Network adapters qualify under this type.

This policy is applicable for Intersight Managed Mode and Standalone servers.

Required Attributes:
  * `name`

Optional Attributes:

  * `domain_qualifiers`
  * `hardware_qualifiers`
  * `server_qualifiers`
